**The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Five Constants’ Transformations and Myriad Changes in the Murky Darkness**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Five Constants’ Transformations and Myriad Changes in the Murky Darkness*. Author unknown. Compiled from four early Supreme Clarity scriptural formulas: *The Flying Steps of the Void Constant Formula*, *The Dragon-Soaring Silk Measure Formula*, *The Jade Talisman of the Spirit-Flight with White Feathers and Black Wings*, and *The Nine Perfected’s Ascension to the Mysterious Record of the Flying Feather Scripture*. One scroll. Base text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, *Cavern Mystery Section*, *Scriptural Writings Category*.

---

The Most High Lord of the Great Dao said: The Void Constant is the hun-soul and po-soul of Heaven and Earth, the majestic brilliance of yin and yang. The Void is the hun-essence of the Nine Heavens; the Constant is the po-spirit of the Nine Earths. Their two qi congeal to form the great spirit of the Imperial Honored One, whose radiance aids and illuminates. The Void Constant, with its aiding brilliance as its gaze, commands the movement of celestial light, surveys the ten thousand directions, records the celestial lodges, revolves the Five Constants, summons and directs gatherings, and hastens the turning of mechanisms. When Heaven is at rest and Earth at peace, the Void Constant conceals itself; when Heaven is in decline and Earth in turmoil, the Void Constant shines forth. Fortune and misfortune, omens and portents—it instantly reports all inauspicious signs. The transformations of the myriad qi, the alterations of yin and yang, the succession of the four seasons—none occur without its agency. Thus, the two stars are revered and noble, hidden within the splendor of dawn, their wondrous subtlety belonging to the Void Constant, rarely to be glimpsed. Those who behold the two stars gain boundless longevity; those who cultivate and preserve this Dao ascend in flight to the Hall of Splendor. This is the secret teaching of the Highest Perfected.

The Prime Minister, the Azure Lad, respectfully inquired: The Dao of the Void Constant is spiritually resonant and wondrously noble—may it be heard?

The Most High Lord of the Great Dao said: The Void Constant is the supreme name of Heaven and Earth, yet it is called the Nameless. Blended into one, it becomes the Named. However, the Nine Heavens guard its spiritual resonance, which does not circulate in scriptural texts. Since it employs its aiding brilliance for seeing and hearing, relying on light and shadow to communicate with the real, the Imperial Honored One receives it to govern, and scholars wield it to attain immortality. It causes those with intention to seek it in the unfathomable, and thus it is again named the Named. Though named, it is not transmitted to the reckless; none can fathom it. Those who esteem it yet fail to attain its truth—how could this serve as the foundation for encouraging study? Yet the Nine Heavens have decreed that only those destined to possess the Dark Chart and Jade Characters, inscribed on the Fangzhu and bamboo slips, and those born to unite with the real, may partake of its hidden name. You shall oversee the myriad regions, examine the ten thousand immortals, settle the subtle and obscure, and deliver the countless people. You must not rashly disclose it in violation of the prohibitions—guard it well.

Thereupon, the Azure Lad ascended to the Vermilion Chamber of the Cinnabar Spirit above the clouds, purified himself for three months, tore silk to invoke the spirits, and with golden sheep and silver geese, paid homage to Heaven to receive the real. The Lord of the Dao declared: The Nine Heavens have strictures—according to the rules, it is transmitted once in ten thousand kalpas. Now, as the cycles intersect and qi returns to Supreme Clarity, the Dao is to be practiced in this era. Follow the dark statutes: within seven hundred years, there may be one who hears the three transmissions. If none are worthy, seal it and return it to the Nine Heavens, or entrust it to the chambers of the Nine Caves in the famous mountains. To lightly divulge or neglect it brings retribution upon the seven generations: drawing from the dark waves to irrigate the Four Rivers, bearing the weight of the mountains to fill the seas and oceans. This karmic response of fortune and misfortune leaves no room for error. You must clearly heed these words and act with caution.

Whenever one wishes to tread the Void Constant, flying the net to escape form and transform appearance, and soaring into the Jade Clarity, one should practice this seven times in a month. On the Eight Nodes and the Six Ding days, one may also perform this Dao. On the appointed day, enter the chamber, burn incense to the left and right, arrange the mat and diagram, face south, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Close the eyes and visualize the Five Stars shining brilliantly in the five directions. After a long while, let them descend and enter the five viscera within one’s body: the Metal Star into the Lung Palace, the Earth Star into the Spleen Palace, the Fire Star into the Heart Palace, the Wood Star into the Liver Palace, and the Water Star into the Kidney Palace. The Five Stars’ radiance illuminates the five viscera, and one feels the body suffused with warmth. Then visualize the Five August Ladies of the Stars and the Twenty-Five Celestial Lords of the Void Constant’s Dawn, recalling their surnames, personal names, and attire, each in their respective direction.

When all is complete, softly recite the prayer:
*Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth—*
*Together they govern the Four Origins.*
*The dark essence flows and reflects,*
*Illuminating the Five Gates.*
*Within reside the Five August Ladies and Spirit Lords,*
*The Twenty-Five Celestial Lords of the Void Constant,*
*Transforming shapes and shadows,*
*Uniting in thousands, dividing in myriad ways.*
*Descend into the five viscera,*
*Congeal to form Jade Immortals.*
*Refine my seven po,*
*Nurture my three hun.*
*Raise my form to ascend,*
*Fly into the Dipper’s Gate.*
*Roam and play in the Upper Capital,*
*The Five Stars gathered as one.*
*Today, in this dark celebration,*
*I request that all be as recited.*

Afterward, draw in the star-light qi twenty-five times and swallow it. Then rise and ascend the net.

Standing with feet together upon the Star of Great White, hold the breath for seven cycles, then face west and softly recite the prayer:

*Seven Gates of the West,*
*White qi flies in radiance.*
*Above dwells the Luminous Emperor,*
*the Bright August of Lesser Yin.*
*His name is Golden Supreme Essence,*
*robed in feathered garments.*
*Resplendent essence flows and reflects,*
*illuminating the Golden Palace.*
*Named the Five Points,*
*ancestral of the Void Constant,*
*he bears the talisman and raises the standard,*
*summoning yin and seizing yang,*
*transforming water and fire across seventy-four directions.*
*Grant me flying steps,*
*concealing my form to enter the void,*
*driving the white chariot,*
*roaming the cloud chambers.*
*May heaven and earth endure,*
*eternally without end.*

Afterward, tilt the head back and swallow the star-light qi seven times. Then take twelve steps with feet together, standing upon the Star of Quelling, hold the breath for twelve cycles, face southwest, look to the heavens, and softly recite the prayer:

*Four Qi of the Central August,*
*overseeing the Eight Spirits,*
*within the Jade Terrace and Purple Chamber,*
*divine points give rise to transformation.*
*There resides the Primordial August,*
*the Five Emperors’ hidden names,*
*styled the Stepping Constant,*
*serene within the Yellow Court.*
*Clothed in flying clouds,*
*crowned with radiant essence,*
*holding the register and talisman,*
*adorned with falling fire bells,*
*grant me flying steps,*
*reveal to me the divine names.*
*Descend into the spleen palace,*
*quelling the spirits and settling the essence.*
*Ascend to heaven and enter the clouds,*
*concealing my shadow and eluding my form,*
*transforming the myriad things,*
*roaming the Jade Clarity.*
*May I, with the August Lord,*
*together preserve the Great Luminance.*

Afterward, draw in the star-light qi twelve times and swallow it. Then take three steps with feet together, standing upon the Star of Blazing Deluder, hold the breath for three cycles, face south, and softly recite the prayer:

*Three Gates gleam resplendent,*
*cinnabar light flows with essence.*
*Mysterious qi surges and billows,*
*illuminating the Southern Darkness.*
*Above dwells the Crimson August,*
*the Five Emperors’ bright spirits.*
*His name is Wandering Radiance,*
*clothed in brocade and patterned essence,*
*crowned with a treasure diadem,*
*girded with jade bells.*
*He enters and exits the Vermilion Palace,*
*the Purple Chamber and Crimson Citadel.*
*Preserve my life’s record,*
*inscribed in the Southern Palace.*
*Grant me flying steps,*
*transforming my qi and concealing my form.*
*On an auspicious day, walk the Dao,*
*universally purifying heaven and earth.*
*May my heart-spirit congeal in true perfection,*
*the five hun gleam with clarity,*
*aligning with the three qi,*
*merging with the Fire Star’s radiance.*

Afterward, draw in the star-light qi three times and swallow it. Then take nine steps with feet together, standing upon the Star of Jupiter, hold the breath for nine cycles, face east, and softly recite the prayer:

*Nine Qi of the East,*
*Azure Heaven’s Jade Gate.*
*Within dwells the Azure Morning,*
*the Lord of the Mystic Above.*
*Flowing azure surges and billows,*
*this is the Celestial Hun.*
*His name is Great Luminance,*
*exalted of heaven and earth,*
*clothed in phoenix robes,*
*striped skirts of the tiger.*
*Transforming the Five Points,*
*shifting forms in nine aspects,*
*crowned with azure essence,*
*adorned with the Heaven-Crossing Jade Diadem.*
*Golden talismans and feathered standards,*
*jingling pendants in profusion,*
*holding the Hidden Script,*
*flying with feathered script.*
*Preserve my life’s record,*
*guard my liver’s gate.*
*Externally radiant, internally luminous,*
*the liver palace congeals into immortals.*
*Welcome my ascent,*
*to audience with the Imperial Morning.*

Afterward, draw in the star-light qi nine times and swallow it. Then take five steps with feet together, standing upon the Star of Mercury, hold the breath for five cycles, face north, and softly recite the prayer:

*Five Qi of the Northern Mystery,*
*the Mystic Gate gleams with spirit.*
*The Northern Morning flows and reflects,*
*the Great Culmen of Jade Clarity.*
*Within dwells the Supreme August,*
*the Five Constants’ exalted name.*
*His name is Yin’s Primordial Stillness,*
*robed in mysterious clarity,*
*crowned with a jade diadem,*
*girded with flowing bells,*
*golden seals and jade standards,*
*jade pendants gleaming resplendent.*
*Wandering the radiant morning,*
*gazing beside the Eight Darknesses,*
*returning to descend below,*
*entering my kidney court.*
*Preserve the five spirits’ record,*
*the viscera flourishing in brilliance.*
*Internally and externally replete,*
*transforming my shadow and altering my form,*
*bones flying, flesh ascending,*
*ascending to Jade Clarity.*

Afterward, tilt the head back and draw in the star-light qi five times and swallow it. Having completed the steps of the Five Stars, descend from the Star of Water, ascend seven steps from the Star of Metal, and again mount the Void Constant Register.

First, stand with feet together upon the First Nine Constants and recite the prayer:
*Lord of the Nine Constants of Earth,*
*shifting forms in the hidden darkness,*
*grant me concealed steps,*
*to elude my form.*

Next, ascend to the Second Nurturing Constant and recite the prayer:
*Spirit Lord of the Nurturing Constant,*
*whose form has no fixed attire,*
*grant me transformation,*
*that my body become grass and trees.*

Next, ascend to the Third Mao Constant and recite the prayer:
*Exalted Spirit of the Mao Constant,*
*able to sink and to rise,*
*grant me transformed radiance,*
*shifting into hills and mounds.*

Next, ascend to the Fourth Flowing Constant and recite the prayer:
*August Lord of the Flowing Constant,*
*whose form has no constant body,*
*grant me exhalation,*
*arousing qi and kindling smoke.*

Next, ascend to the Fifth Walking Constant and recite the prayer:
*Great Lord of the Walking Constant,*
*whose might subdues the myriad ghosts,*
*transform my form,*
*kindling smoke into fire.*

Having completed the steps of the Five Constants, return to the Star of Metal, hold the breath for five cycles, and recite the prayer:

*Flying into the Great Hidden,*
*transforming radiance through the Five Constants,*
*entering the Five Qi of the North,*
*controlling the Three Yangs of the South.*
*Golden talismans command the spirits,*
*the Supreme Emperor aids and upholds.*
*Six Wus escape the Six Jis,*
*preserving passage to the Cavern Realm.*
*Great White guards the lungs,*
*Metal stabilizes the stomach and intestines.*
*Internally replete, externally overflowing,*
*form and hun together soar.*
*Transforming in thousands, shifting in myriad ways,*
*welcoming whatever the intent desires.*
*May I, with the Jade August,*
*together roam the Upper Capital.*

Afterward, draw in the qi seven times and swallow it. Then take twelve steps from the Star of Metal to mount the Star of Earth, stand with feet together upon the First Upper Constant, and recite the prayer:
*Upper Constant soaring,*
*transforming in countless millions,*
*grant me concealed radiance,*
*ascending into the Nine Heavens.*

Next, ascend to the Second Heavenly Constant and recite the prayer:
*Heavenly Constant flowing with flame,*
*kindling smoke into ramparts,*
*grant me eluding form,*
*carrying the spirit into fire.*

Next, ascend to the Third Named Constant and recite the prayer:
*Named Constant of the Northern Mystery,*
*whose body is water,*
*conceal me in rivers and seas,*
*irrigate me to perfection.*

Next, ascend to the Fourth Three Constants and recite the prayer:
*Three Constants transforming might,*
*radiance controlling the Eight Courts,*
*grant me attainment of immortality,*
*warding off disaster and repelling weapons.*

Next, ascend to the Fifth Chen Constant and recite the prayer:
*Chen Constant of myriad transformations,*
*whose body has no constant form,*
*grant me attainment of immortality,*
*escaping death and entering life.*

Having completed the steps of the Five Constants, return to the Star of Earth, hold the breath for twelve cycles, and knock the teeth together twelve times, then recite the prayer:

The Primal Constant of the Five Yellows,
Central August Divine Sovereign,
transforms the Seven Metals,
subdues the Three Luminaries with might,
escapes the body and divides the form,
ascends to heaven and enters the clouds.
Summon the Five Spirits in unison,
guard my Spleen Gate,
that my organs and viscera
may swiftly transform into immortality.
Soaring into the void, entering the emptiness,
water and fire span the ten thousand origins—
all as my will desires,
ascending without hindrance,
to join the August Consort,
befriending the host of equals.

Complete, draw in the breath and swallow twelve times to conclude.

Next, from the Star of Earth take three steps,
ascend to the Star of Fire, feet together,
and mount the First Void Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Void Constant most numinous,*
*assisting and aiding the Supreme Perfected,*
*enter my Crimson Palace,*
*governing the host of immortals.*

Next, ascend to the Second River Constant, reciting the prayer:
*River Constant of escape and concealment,*
*hidden in the Eight Obscurities,*
*transforming through water and fire,*
*grant me attainment of immortality.*

Next, ascend to the Third Primal Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Primal Constant of transformation,*
*grass and trees conceal my body,*
*that my form and shadow*
*may unite with the perfection of the Dao.*

Next, ascend to the Fourth Ancient Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Ancient Constant of celestial pairing,*
*entering and exiting without hindrance,*
*my body sprouts feathered wings,*
*soaring upward to the heavens.*

Next, ascend to the Fifth Si Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Si Constant of the Southern Li,*
*erecting the Ninefold Self-Covering,*
*transforming and completing the form,*
*instantly becoming the roaring beast.*

Having completed the steps of the Five Constants, return to the Star of Fire,
hold the breath for three cycles, and knock the teeth together three times, then recite the prayer:
*Flowing flame, cinnabar numen,*
*Three Gates like lightning coursing,*
*Five Constants transforming and communicating,*
*myriad transformations flourishing in obscurity.*
*Seize the life of the Earth Sovereign,*
*subdue the might of the Northern Essence.*
*Preserve the Upper Prime Record,*
*fortify my long life.*
*Today I step through the void,*
*riding the emptiness into the stars.*
*Mars aids my heart,*
*my Dao shines with clarity.*
*A thousand divisions, ten thousand unions—*
*all I face is instantly accomplished.*
*Spirit guides, soul refines,*
*feathered raiment timely born.*
*Attaining the Five Stars,*
*I grasp the chariot of Jade Clarity.*

Complete, draw in the breath and swallow three times to conclude.

Next, from the Star of Fire take nine steps,
reach the Star of Wood, feet together,
and mount the Nine Constants, reciting the prayer:
*Nine Constants of the Azure Sovereign,*
*root of the soul of heaven and earth,*
*grant me transformation,*
*escaping my shadow and concealing myself in the mountains.*

Next, ascend to the World Constant, reciting the prayer:
*World Constant of celestial numen,*
*governing the deliverance of the host of immortals,*
*grant me to step through the void,*
*uniting with my shadow to become a spirit.*

Next, ascend to the Luminous Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Luminous Constant shining bright,*
*radiance illuminating the Eight Corners,*
*grant me transformation of form,*
*escaping water to become earth.*

Next, ascend to the Five Constants, reciting the prayer:
*Five Constants of mighty transformation,*
*controlling and commanding the Five Lands,*
*grant me transformation of form,*
*instantly standing as a tiger.*

Next, ascend to the Dharma Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Dharma Constant manifesting wood,*
*position governing the divine immortals,*
*grant me division of my shadow,*
*transforming my body into a thousand.*

Having completed the steps of the Five Constants, return to the Star of Wood,
hold the breath for nine cycles, and knock the teeth together nine times, then recite the prayer:
*Lesser Yang of the Nine Gates,*
*wandering the azure heavens,*
*within are the Five Constants,*
*transforming in countless millions.*
*Summon yin, call forth yang,*
*commanding the Metal Spirit.*
*Eastern Florescence receives the mandate,*
*sitting in accord with spontaneity.*
*Stepping through the void, treading the empty,*
*urging the chariot of blue mist,*
*ascending to the Azure Numen,*
*below guarding the Gate of the Liver.*
*The Dao illumines the Nine Unions,*
*instantly attaining flight as an immortal,*
*joining the Azure Sovereign,*
*as one with the Perfected of the Wooden Dawn.*

Complete, draw in the breath and swallow nine times to conclude.

Next, from the Star of Wood take five steps,
reach the Star of Water, feet together,
and mount the Yin Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Yin Constant of the Northern Mystery,*
*origin of the myriad transformations,*
*grant me to dwell here,*
*instantly becoming the divine dragon.*

Next, ascend to the Yellow Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Yellow Constant of numinous yin,*
*transforming into the Jade Maiden,*
*grant me division of form,*
*instantly becoming a hundred selves.*

Next, ascend to the Stabilizing Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Stabilizing Constant governing the origin,*
*transformations flourishing and exuberant,*
*grant me division of form,*
*to become the myriad things.*

Next, ascend to the Flying Constant, reciting the prayer:
*Flying Constant entering the void,*
*ascending and descending in a hundred rhymes,*
*transforming the form into the six livestock,*
*that others may not see me.*

Next, ascend to the Six Constants, reciting the prayer:
*Six Constants of the fundamental bond,*
*commanding ghosts and controlling spirits,*
*revolving heaven and earth,*
*confronting them slays men.*

Having completed the steps of the Five Constants, return to the Star of Water,
hold the breath for five cycles, and knock the teeth together five times, then recite the prayer:
*Northern Mystery of the Five Qi,*
*Five Gates opening wide,*
*Central Star of the Black Sovereign,*
*styled the Five Constants.*
*Transformations in the hidden and obscure,*
*exiting yin and entering yang,*
*summoning the life of the Three Luminaries,*
*commanding the Earth Officials.*
*Grant me to fly and step,*
*escaping my shadow into the great void,*
*wherever I turn,*
*dividing my form in a hundred directions.*
*Ascending to the Hook Array,*
*raising my body to Jade Capital,*
*my body sprouts wondrous fur,*
*the Palace of the Kidneys receives fragrance.*
*Today I practice the Dao,*
*the origin of divine immortals,*
*attaining the wish of heaven,*
*enjoying blessings without end.*

Complete, draw in the breath and swallow five times to conclude.

Thus completing the steps of the Twenty-Five Point Constants,
descend, knock the teeth together thirty-six times at the gate,
face the guiding cord and chant the *Three Caverns Flying Steps Chapter*,
then take nine steps to ascend the Star of Yang Brightness.

Feet together, mount the Star of Yang Brightness,
face east and recite the prayer:
*Within the Palace of the Supreme One,*
*transforming, concealing, and escaping the origin,*
*the Great Divine Consort within,*
*the Most Honored of the Great One,*
*governing the records of life,*
*speak on my behalf,*
*concealing my form and escaping myself,*
*ascending to the imperial chariot.*

Next, ascend to the Star of Yin Essence,
face northeast and recite the prayer:
*Within the Palace of the Middle Prime,*
*preserving the embryo and transforming the form,*
*the Divine Consort within,*
*the Supreme Numen of the Lofty One,*
*severing the afterbirth and untying the knots,*
*refining the embryo and securing the essence,*
*transforming in myriad ways,*
*granting me long life.*

Next, ascend to the Star of the Aiding Star,
face the Star of the Perfected and recite the prayer:
*Within the Palace of the True Origin,*
*Six Escapes and Seven Concealments,*
*the Mysterious Mother of the Upper Prime,*
*nurturing my embryonic birth,*
*concealing and transforming in the Golden Chamber,*
*transforming into the Azure Chariot,*
*granting me to fly through the void,*
*endless years without limit.*

Next, ascend to the Star of the Dark and Mysterious,
face north and recite the prayer:
*Within the Palace of the Axis of Obscurity,*
*concealing my shadow and hiding my light,*
*the Divine Consort within,*
*great origin of divine immortals,*
*delivering me through the Six Wus,*
*exiting me through the Eight Directions,*
*escaping my traces, flying and stepping,*
*transcending to the imperial chambers.*

Next, ascend to the Star of Cinnabar Origin,
face west and recite the prayer:

Within the Palace of the Starry Net,
transforming my form and altering my radiance,
the Great Maiden within the Dipper,
mysterious transformation without image,
delivering me through the Primordial Dipper,
inscribing my name upon the imperial register,
soaring through the void and riding the emptiness,
ascending in body to cast no shadow.

Next, ascend to the Star of the Northern Pole,
face northeast and recite the prayer:
Within the Palace of the Bright Record,
concealing my traces and dispersing the multitudes,
the Middle Maiden within the Dipper,
numinous transformation of the Upper Palace,
striking my name from the Mysterious Register,
inscribing it through all directions,
dividing my body into a thousand,
returning my countenance to that of an infant.

Next, ascend to the Star of the Celestial Pass,
face northwest and recite the prayer:
Within the Palace of the Converging Pass,
splitting my radiance into ten thousand forms,
the Youngest Maiden within the Dipper,
great numen of the Mysterious Upper Realm,
following the Dipper’s revolving mechanism,
governing the myriad lives,
granting me to fly through the void,
transforming into the Great Obscurity.

Next, ascend to the Star of the Assistant,
face the Gate of Heaven, knock the teeth nine times, and recite the prayer:
Within the Upper Palace of the Imperial Couch,
the August Consort of the Right,
facing the Imperial Lord above,
aligning her radiance with the True,
named the Wondrous Constancy,
transforming through the Nine Heavens,
guiding and conveying the sun and moon,
gathering qi to form mist,
revolving water and fire,
concealing the myriad anomalies within,
at this time of primordial auspiciousness,
proclaiming the Mysterious Blessing,
granting me to fly in steps,
riding the Constant to enter the True,
the Nine Dawns flowing and scattering,
enjoying ten thousand blessings,
my form equaling the radiance of heaven,
my virtue harmonizing with the Three Conveniences.

When finished, face upward and swallow qi twenty-four times to conclude.

Next, ascend to the Star of the Supporter,
face the Earthly Door, knock the teeth nine times, and recite the prayer:
Within the Upper Palace of the Supreme,
the August Consort of the Right,
equal in honor to the Imperial Lord,
uniting in the Flowery Chamber of the Numinous,
heavenly hun and earthly po,
named the Supreme Void,
transforming through the Nine Qi,
ancestor of the myriad perfected,
revolving metal and turning stone,
equaling the merit of heaven,
dissolving mountains and rivers,
summoning clouds and calling dragons,
the myriad anomalies instantly vanishing,
splitting my radiance into a hundred million,
flying in steps upon the void,
streaming brilliance through the four directions,
concealing my body within the Dipper’s seat,
cloaking myself in the radiance of heaven,
eternally numinous between heaven and earth,
enjoying boundless blessings,
may all be as wished,
receiving fortune forever.

When finished, face upward and swallow qi thirty-six times to conclude.
All these are performed in a single passage, without retracing.

The Dao of the Eternal Void concludes here.

The Most High practices the Dao of the Eternal Void. On each appointed day, they purify themselves, burn incense, and seclude in a separate chamber, free from worldly affairs, performing the rites in secrecy. Calming the mind and settling the intent, they visualize the divine perfected, with stars arrayed in orderly ranks, each distinct and clear. They proceed slowly, stepping through the celestial net.

Within five years, the Imperial Lord and the August Consort descend without fail; the Primordial August Five Stars cast their radiance without omission. The inner form becomes luminously clear, and the myriad spirits undergo transformation. After seven years of practice, one may divide their form into a myriad manifestations and conceal their traces within the Nine Voids. After fourteen years, they soar through the Great Void, ascending to the Dipper’s dawn.

If constrained by worldly duties or circumstances, should one obtain this scripture but be unable to perform the stepping ritual, simply burn incense, hold the scripture, face north toward the stars, and visualize the divine perfected, praying for transcendence. Thus, all calamities are averted, misfortunes dispelled, the spirit brightens, the body purifies, and one regains youthful countenance. Practicing thus for fourteen years extends life by seven hundred years.

Impurity, negligence, or leakage of secrets brings ruin upon the entire household, with punishment extending to the seven generations of ancestors. The correspondence of sin and fortune is most evident. From here, proceed with seven steps to ascend upon the Metal Star and recite one invocation. From the Metal Star, take twelve steps to ascend upon the Earth Star and recite another invocation. From the Earth Star, take three steps to ascend upon the Fire Star and recite another invocation. From the Fire Star, take nine steps to ascend upon the Wood Star and recite another invocation. From the Wood Star, take five steps to ascend upon the Water Star and recite another invocation. When the Five Stars are completed, recite one final invocation. Then, beginning again from the Metal Star, repeat the sequence fifteen times in reverse, stepping without invocation. Thus, the Dao is fulfilled.

After completing the steps of the Five Stars, proceed from the outer path with seven steps to ascend upon the Earth Gate of the Nine Constants, then proceed through the Five Constants in sequence. Return to the Metal Star and recite one invocation, then take twelve steps to ascend upon the Upper Constant and proceed through the Five Constants in sequence. Return to the Earth Star and recite one invocation, then take three steps to ascend upon the Void Constant and proceed through the Five Constants in sequence. Return to the Fire Star and recite one invocation, then take nine steps to ascend upon the Nine Constants and proceed through the Five Constants in sequence. Return to the Wood Star and recite one invocation, then take five steps to ascend upon the Yin Constant and proceed through the Five Constants in sequence. Then, they bow once to each of the five directions, beginning in the west, circling to the south, and ending in the west, prostrating to the east and placing the ram and crow to the master’s left and right.
The master stands at the center, faces north, and knocks his teeth nine times, declaring:
*"I, the Perfected Minister of [Name] Peak, [Personal Name], dare, at this auspicious time of triple conjunction, ascend the imperial altar, bare my form and sincere heart, purify my fast, and partake of cinnabar. I array this oath before heaven."*

May the Most High deign to cast its radiance upon this humble servant, turning its gaze to the Minister of [Name] Peak, [Personal Name], whom the Northern Emperor has exalted. May the blessings of past lives extend deeply into future rebirths, the wheel of fortune turning without cease across the Nine Heavens. Inscribed upon the mystic registers of destiny, this day I am granted the vision to behold the arcane scriptures and the voice to chant the hymns of the Imperial Unity. Envious of the immortals and yearning for divine communion, I now, within the midst of [Name] Heaven, receive the rites of transcendence—the esoteric formulas of feathered flight through empty space.

I hereby supplicate the Ten Thousand Emperors, the Supreme Primal Sovereign, the Lofty Immortals and Great Saints, the Boundless Lords of the Dao, beseeching them to turn their luminous gaze and graciously oversee this sacred covenant. May the qi of the Perfected Immortals of the Jade Pure Upper Palace attend and guard my person. I invoke the Five Emperors, the Five Peaks, the myriad spirits, the river and sea deities—all to bear witness to this oath and to transmit the teachings in accordance with the established protocols.

The left half of the silk writ shall be inscribed on two *chi* of white silk, with one half on each *chi*, the two halves joined by a central talisman. The recipient shall inscribe the master’s taboo name in purple ink, and the text and talisman in vermilion. Once the master’s transmission of the taboo name is complete, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens shall attend the recipient’s person. The central talisman shall then be split, each half to be worn upon the body: the left for men, the right for women. The writ shall be encased in a cinnabar-silk pouch and worn over the heart.

Beware the veils of life and death—three transgressions shall scatter the celestial lodgings, and the Five Emperors shall weep in lament. The soul’s essence shall dissipate, the spirit wander astray, and the hun and po be lost, bringing death within the year. The prohibitions of the Nine Heavens are absolute: observe them, and the numinous radiance of heaven shall descend, divine immortals shall alight, the body shall command water and fire, and the myriad transformations shall submit of their own accord.

**The Jade Talisman of the White-Feathered, Black-Quilled Numinous Flight**

The Primordial Father of the Nine Heavens and the Celestial Mother, the Supreme Perfected Lord, together ascended the resplendent dragon chariot, accompanied by the thousand immortals and ten thousand riders of the Mulberry Grove. The flying immortals harnessed this celestial wheel, swift as lightning and fleeting as mist, their bodies moving in harmony with the cosmos. They chanted sacred hymns, wandering the caverns of the Mystic Mound, resting by the limpid waves, roaming the purple void’s embrace, and halting at the timeless edge of the ageless realm.

At that moment, the celestial origin shone brilliantly, the five dawns turned their light, and the three pure clouds wove purple mists, exhaling fragrant blossoms that encircled the sun, their fragrance dispersing into the Great Void. Radiant splendor intertwined, the three torches merged their brilliance, congealing the true essence in perfect union. They chewed the root of the sun, imbibed the mysterious and infused the void, unfurled the resplendent golden scriptures, and intoned the nine subtleties in a resonant chant. The numinous chariot soared, their wondrous thoughts stirring the Great Silence, their inner contemplation awakening the Spontaneous.

On the third day of the third month of the first year of the *Above Emperor* era, at the dawn of the Primordial’s revelation, the Mystic Numinous descended in a chariot drawn by white simurghs, black-quilled phoenixes bearing in their beaks the silk writ of the *Feathered Flight through Empty Space*. The jade essence of the flying immortals guided the mist, the host of spirits guarded the numinous, their luminous presence suffusing the Nine Empyreans, resplendent in the courtyard of the Jade Void. They descended upon the Mystic Mound of the Supreme Perfected to transmit the precious scriptures.

On that day, as the Supreme Perfected Lord completed his fast in the Upper Clarity, the Celestial Emperor of the Great Thearch, the Three Pure Primordial Ladies of the Purple Tenuity, the Heavenly Emperor, the Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity, and the august guests of the Lofty Jade Sovereign all descended together. They kindled incense of a hundred harmonies, arrayed the floating banners of the five-colored spirit officials, and took their jade seats in the Purple Palace. The assembled immortals circumambulated the scriptures thrice, whereupon the Three Pure Primordial Ladies rose, faced west, and intoned in a voice of mystic clarity the *Ode of Celebration for the Feathered Writ*, extolling the divine scriptures. Their words began:

*"The vapors gather in the halls of the Great Void,
A numinous wind scatters rare fragrance..."*

The mystic radiance soars aloft in the void,
A gentle breeze bears the sun on its wings.
The white simurgh swiftly follows the phoenix,
Its beak holding the divine *Feathered Writ*.
Beating their pinions, they shake the nine heavens,
Their mournful cries illumine the dark beams.
Arcane incantations issue forth through the air,
The pure governance of the Dao knows no end.
The assembled immortals join in celebration,
Bowing their heads in homage to the Jade Sovereign.

When the recitation concluded, the Celestial Emperor of the Great Thearch rose again, facing north, and intoned:

*"The dark phoenix darts on cloud-wings,
The white simurgh rejoices in its stride.
Flying fragrance blends with fragrant blossoms,
Meteors gleam along the clouded thoroughfares.
A mighty rainbow reins the long bridle,
Flying immortals support one another.
The ten thousand perfected celebrate this felicitous fortune,
Joyous phoenixes roam the empty midst.
The Primal Beginning leaves no trace,
Yet the mystic resonance seeks itself.
Beating their wings without awaiting a chariot,
They drift lightly upon the mists of affinity.
The treasure scripture weaves the dark warp,
The five bodies command the numinous talismans.
In celebration they bow before the Court of Blessings,
Circumambulating the incense thrice."*

When this recitation ended, the Heavenly Emperor rose, facing east, and intoned:

*"White feathers and dark wings flutter,
Riding the floating mists in cyclic return.
Flowing fragrance overflows the ten heavens,
Fragrant fungi flourish in the Supreme Tenuity.
The numinous scripture unlocks the hidden mechanism,
The *Feathered Writ* shines with mystic splendor.
The supreme Dao is fundamentally without obscurity,
Holding fast to the true, the radiant scene soars white."*

When this too concluded, the Venerable Lord of the Great Perfected donned his ritual vestments: a crown of the Infinite Three Treasures of Heaven, a robe of seamless nine-colored flying clouds adorned with luminous feathered script, a tinkling bell at his left, and the Seven Primes at his right. Facing due south, he prostrated himself. The Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity then commanded the Feathered Immortal Attendant to raise a golden table, bearing the scripture as he stood facing north, and presented it to the Great Perfected. All the immortals voiced their approval, and the Great Perfected rose to receive the scripture. A golden light emanated from his countenance, and the five agents of his body spontaneously generated the *Numinous Flying Jade Talismans*. Ascending with the assembled perfected, they boarded the white simurgh’s chariot, drawn by black-winged phoenixes, to feast in the verdant groves and azure waters of the Eastern Expanse of Eternal Yang, the precincts of Fusang, the mouth of the Nine Springs. They journeyed west to the dark-feathered plain of the White Wilderness by the banks of the Mengsi, south to the Crimson Mound and the essence of extreme flame in the southern lands of Xia, north to the frigid halls of the Northern Darkness and the abode of the Cold Waters, and circled the ten absolute peaks of the Yellow Qi and the Yang Essence in the Great Mysterious Jade Capital, the Golden Terrace, the Jade Chamber, and the Cinnabar Palace. They roamed the ten heavens and the eight domains of the Grotto Clarity, governing the countless perfected. No heaven was beyond their reach, no hidden realm beyond their purview, no *qi* beyond their command, no immortal beyond their charge. They universally governed the host of spirits, and from heaven downward, none failed to model their virtue upon the Great Perfected or revere the *Feathered Writ*.

Thereupon, the Celestial Lords each ascended their dark palanquins, and after seven thousand kalpas, transmitted the scripture to the Most High Lord of the Great Dao. The *Upper Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Dark Immortal Feathered Essence* is worn for seven years, enabling one to ride the void and ascend to the Seven Primes. Those who cultivate the *Feathered Writ’s* flying paces without this talisman cannot ascend the void to the dark mysteries. The recipient pledges to heaven with ninety feet of azure brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the left palm allows one to grasp the azure radiance and take flight. Inscribing nine inches of azure silk and wearing it on the left elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending at the left.

The *Lower Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Primal Feathered Essence of Dark Jade* is worn for seven years, enabling one to ride the void and ascend to the Five Stars. Those who practice the flying paces to ascend the dark mysteries without this talisman cannot traverse the void. The recipient pledges to heaven with sixty feet of white brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the right palm allows one to grasp the white radiance and take flight. Inscribing nine inches of white silk and wearing it on the right elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending at the right.

The *Left Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Dark Qi’s Primal Essence and White Feathered Writ* is worn for nine years, enabling one to ride the void and ascend to the Five Stars. Those who practice the flying paces to ascend the dark mysteries without this talisman cannot tread the clouds to ascend the dark mysteries. The recipient pledges to heaven with eighty feet of cinnabar brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the sole of the left foot allows one to tread the void and take flight. Inscribing nine inches of crimson silk and wearing it on the left elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending at the front.

The *Right Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Primal Qi’s Essence and Ascending Dark Feathered Writ* is worn for nine years, enabling one to ride the flying clouds and traverse the Jade Clarity. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the sole of the right foot allows one to tread the dark and take flight. In all practices of meditative visualization upon the Seven Stars, one must first ingest the five talismans before inscribing them. When inscribing or ingesting the talismans, face east, click the teeth twelve times, and pray aloud:

*"Dark Void and Purple Clarity,
Flying *Feathered Writ*,
Above you illumine the cloud palaces,
Below you command the thousand spirits.
You govern the Six Jia,
Transport my bodily form,
Traverse the celestial warp,
Ascend to grasp the Dipper’s essence.
Congeal the hun and solidify the po,
Internally secure and fill the self.
Exiting the void and entering the dark,
Ever abide with the qi."*

Upon completion, ingest the talisman and inscribe it upon the five centers, then proceed with the practice. After nine years of such cultivation, one may ride the void and command the clouds, flying through the Great Clarity. The *Left* and *Right Numinous Flying Jade Talismans* emerge from the *qi* of spontaneity, transmitted by the Great Perfected to ascend the void, tread the celestial warp, entwine the Seven Primes, and ascend to the Jade Clarity, perfecting the *Flying Feathered Writ*.

Those who attain it become divine immortals; those who wear it become perfected beings. Those who cultivate it summon the white-luan chariot and the black-winged phoenix to welcome their bodies, ascending to the Jade Clarity Palace to roam and feast in the Eternal Yang. The Most High Lord of the Great Dao transmitted it to the Supreme Prime Lord of Grand Simplicity and the Celestial Emperor of the Grand Tenuity. Those who violate the covenant and betray their oaths will have their bodies consigned to the offices of ghosts, their misfortune extending to nine generations, bound in the Dark Springs.

*The Flying Feathered Writ: Nine Perfected Ascending to the Primordial Upper Record*
The Most High Lord of the Great Dao once received *The Flying Feathered Writ: Nine Perfected Ascending to the Primordial Upper Record*, its treasured words inscribed in purple script and green-gold characters, the Dao of traversing the void and treading the empty sky upon floating radiance, bestowed by the Highest Lord of the Dao in the Jade Clarity Upper Palace. Thereupon, the Most High Lord of the Great Dao transmitted its essentials to the Jade Emperor of the Highest Clarity. The Jade Emperor of the Highest Clarity transmitted it to the Supreme Prime Lord of Grand Simplicity, who in turn transmitted it to the Celestial Emperor of the Grand Tenuity. To receive the *Flying Feathered Writ*, scatter gold as an oath. To know the taboos of immortality, offer a silk kerchief as a pledge. Once you comprehend the feathered scripture, heaven and earth become as one. Having heard these mysterious words, you shall transcend and ride the auspicious clouds—this is what it means.

*Inscribed on the stone stele of the Terrace of Committed Feathers.*

The Three Primordial Lords of Grand Simplicity have said: Immortals first know the Dao of concealing themselves beneath the Dipper’s stars, yet do not know the method by which perfected beings conceal the Dipper’s stars. The Nine Dipper stars are the true canopy of the Celestial Pivot, the radiant treasure of the Mysterious Axis, the mechanism that binds the eight directions, the hub that revolves the nine measures. They turn and shade the square and round, governing and harmonizing the qi, regulating yin and yang, presiding over all without exception.

The Dipper’s stars—brilliant and luminous—veil the night. The turning jade mechanism sets them in motion. The Four Symbols flow and descend from them. Mysterious brightness shines resplendently, their majestic radiance blazing. The Supreme Lord of the Great Void has said: Immortals merely know how to chew yin and yang, to exhale and inhale the two qi, yet do not know that the Dipper’s stars are the root and repository of yin and yang, the mysterious warp of the two images. They toil arduously at the waves’ ends, failing to recognize the ease of tending to the source. They shelter beneath its branches and leaves, yet lose the root and foundation. Why not conceal the Nine Dipper, refining and forging the supreme image?

Practice this for fourteen years, and the Most High shall welcome you with a jade wheel. You shall traverse the void and tread the empty sky, ascending to the Highest Clarity, ranked among the supreme perfected. Your spirit shall return, your countenance rejuvenated, and all spirits shall attend your chariot. The Azure Lad has said: Immortals merely know the great majesty of the turning jade mechanism, its brilliance startling the myriad stars. They behold the flowing radiance of the nine paths, delight in its circular motion to gather the spirit, sheltering beneath it to seek great attainment, employing it to seek divine immortality. Yet they still do not know how to turn the nine lights inward to illuminate, to conceal the bright Dipper within the muddy pellet. Thereby, the hun is congealed and the po refined, virtue and cloud-mist harmonized. Those who master this Dao ascend to the Highest Clarity; those who attain it become supreme perfected.

Thus, the perfected embrace the great image to conceal the radiance, enclose the Dipper’s essence to hide the self. My former master therefore rode upon green clouds to the left, reined the crimson dawn to the right, ascending to Grand Simplicity, traversing the void and treading the empty sky. Visualize the Dipper’s stars as purple, its warp as red. Sense the purple qi as warm and gentle. Envision the stars’ sizes as you practice. This is the oral instruction of the Azure Lad.

Formerly, Master Wucheng, Master Guxi, Master Guangcheng, and Master Qingzhen together visualized the qi of the Dipper’s stars, merging it with their bodies to enter the lotus seed. Suddenly, they beheld within the lotus a golden pond a thousand leagues wide, jade mountains ten thousand qing in expanse. Palaces, terraces, chambers, and halls stretched unbroken into the clouds. Vermilion trees bore fruit, purple blossoms bloomed in gardens. Azure carriages and mysterious yellow banners, the Three Simplicities and Eight Wheels—wondrous sights beyond naming.

The four masters roamed for some time, then turned their gaze in leisurely contemplation and returned. At that moment, they were unaware of the lotus seed’s center—such is the principle of the great entering the small, transformation without trace, the utmost resonance of stellar visualization, the essence of vastness and constriction. Thus may the tip of a hair become the Eight Extremes; how could the lotus seed not be wondrous?

On the first, third, or fifth day of the lunar month, at midday or midnight—these are the appointed times. Enter the hall, sit upright, face north, and clasp your hands. Regulate the breath, close the eyes, and then visualize the nine stars of the Northern Dipper descending into the head’s Mud-Pill Palace, with the Dipper’s handle pointing forward and its bowl tilted upward. After a long while, suddenly behold within the Dipper’s bowl a great divine figure, whose robes and name accord with the invocation’s words. After a great while, the head should grow slightly warm, gently so. This is the true qi of the Nine Essences of the Upper Prime entering the head, thus the unusual warmth—a sign of response to the verification of resonance.

Then swallow saliva fifty times and click the teeth nine times. With the left hand’s third finger, press between the brows and softly recite the prayer:

“Supreme Purple Radiance, honored of the Nine Paths,
Canopy of sevenfold splendor, revolving brilliance of ten thousand dawns,
Moving, you command the lofty spirits; still, you harmonize with the luminous clouds.
Yin and yang flow and irrigate, the single qi divides at the center,
Roaming and aiding beyond all bounds, illuminating and brightening the host of heavens.
This month, this day, this hour, ascend to the Mud-Pill Palace.
The primal essence gathers and resonates, transforming into a great spirit,
Named Marvelous Pivot, whose child is the Numinous Net,
Seated upright within the Dipper, roaming my Bright Hall.
Feathered phoenix cloak of purple, tiger-embroidered cinnabar robes,
Left side girded with jade pendants, right waist hung with golden bells,
Holding a flowing tassel, head crowned with dawn’s light.
Exhaling qi to bathe the essence, the Mud-Pill Palace is made sound,
Hun and po congeal in harmony, planting the flowering pillars and beams.
Let me become a flying immortal, traversing the void and treading the empty sky,
Ascend to the Upper Clarity, rein the tiger and command the dragon,
Pay court to the Jade Emperor in the north, the Jasper-Limned Upper Palace,
And in the west, prostrate before the Great Simplicity, bowing to the Three Primes.”

When the prayer is finished, swallow saliva thirty times and click the teeth nine times. Recite the prayer again as before, then rise, face north, and bow twice; face west, and bow twice. No longer close the eyes; the practice is complete. This may also be performed on the bed in a quiet chamber, without descending to the ground for the bows.

The true practitioner values stability in what is inherently stable, honoring the wondrous and subtle while avoiding convoluted deviations that disrupt the natural order of rest and repose. The essential Dao is unburdened—thus transcending all comparison. The subsequent three invocations all follow and emulate this method, differing only in their prayers and the orientation of the visualized stars.

The key lies in performing this within a secluded chamber, ensuring no one witnesses the visualization. For during this practice, jade youths and jade maidens stand beside you as overseers. One must not approach mourning rites, encounter corpses, or come into contact with impurities. Clothing, bedding, headscarves, and footwear must not be misused or lent to those of a different kind. What is this "different kind"? Those whose aspirations do not align with yours. Those not of like mind should not share your mat, nor should those not of your covenant share your vessel. Daoists and laypeople differ: those who revere the Six Heavens or serve mountain and river demons must not be entertained in your chamber, nor should you partake of their food, wear their garments, or don their headscarves. This is to avoid the foul qi of their corpse-like impurity and to block the passage of their perverse winds. Such is the true Dao of the true Dao, the essence of the most refined essence.

If one can embody this refinement, one attains the true Dao; by shunning impurity, one gains renewal. But those who dwell in chaos, mingling the foul with the fragrant in the same vessel, failing to distinguish the divine, neglecting to refine their qi, cohabiting with the licentious while sharing space with the upright, allowing perverse winds to unsettle the heart or treading in dust without aspiring to transcendence—such seekers will find no truth. As the radiant pearl does not emerge from a cesspit, nor does mediocre talent flourish in exalted ranks, so too is this principle.

When essence and resonance align, the numinous responds with subtle efficacy. Jade blossoms manifest as signs, and divine radiance shines forth as verification. Unless they are your teacher, do not speak of this lightly.

The great spirits within the Dipper are the essences of the Nine Stars, born suddenly through resonant transformation. When practicing this method, first visualize their names and forms, then conclude with the invocation. After the invocation, the spirits will appear—visualize them again as before. If the star spirit of the Mud-Pill Palace is to be constantly visualized, let it reside within. Model all practices after this example.

Visualize the Dipper’s stars descending until, through intense focus, you suddenly feel them within your form. If at first they do not come, persist in visualization until they seem to dwell within—this is sufficient to evoke resonance. With time, one naturally enters the wondrous.

On the seventh, ninth, and thirteenth days of the lunar month, at the hour of *yu zhong* or midnight, enter your chamber, sit upright, clasp your hands, regulate your breath, and close your eyes. Then visualize the Nine Stars of the Northern Dipper descending into your heart, with the handle of the Dipper pointing upward toward your throat and the *kui* (the Dipper’s bowl) facing outward. After a long while, you will suddenly see within the *kui* a great spirit, clad and named as described in the invocation. Eventually, you will feel warmth in your heart as true qi enters.

Then swallow saliva fifty times and click your teeth nine times. Raise your right hand’s second finger to press your heart, and softly recite the incantation:

*"Supreme Purple Perfection, spirit of the Nine Qi,
Encompassing the myriad measures, the radiant turning jade,
Flying auroras stream with luminous brilliance,
Illuminating the Jade Clarity,
Dark canopy of all dawns,
Yin and Yang divide and unite,
The Four Harmonies descend in exchange,
The Seven Wefts align in sequence,
On this auspicious lunar day,
Come to shine within my heart’s court,
Flying light and boundless radiance,
Filling the Central Palace,
The Six Palaces open their gates,
Flowing essence levels all,
Hun and po refined and tempered,
Attaining the essence of the true,
Resonant transformation at touch,
Myriad transformations instantly complete,
Suddenly the great spirit appears,
Seated steadfast in my heart’s chamber,
Regulating breath and gathering fluids,
A hundred joints flow unobstructed,
Grasping the Dipper and seizing the *kui*,
Gazing afar in all directions,
Named *Xuan Du*,
Styled *Su Kang*,
Crimson-feathered mantle,
Dragon belt and tiger robe,
Body born of jeweled radiance,
Neck bearing a halo of light,
Headscarf of flying dawn,
Crown of heroes rising and falling,
Grant me flight as an immortal,
Soaring through the great void,
Ascending to the Purple Palace,
Paying court to the Jade Emperor in the north,
Commanding the myriad spirits,
All numinous beings in attendance,
Blossoms blooming above my heart,
Auspicious clouds eternal,
Phoenixes cry with tinkling clarity,
Luan-birds sing with resonant chime."*

When the incantation is finished, swallow saliva thirty times and click your teeth nine times. Recite the incantation again as before, then rise, face south, and bow twice. The practice is complete; open your eyes.

On the fifteenth, nineteenth, and twenty-third days of the lunar month, at the hour of *yu zhong* or midnight, enter your chamber, sit upright, clasp your hands, regulate your breath, and close your eyes. Then visualize the Nine Stars of the Northern Dipper descending into the Lower Palace, three inches below the navel, with the Dipper’s handle pointing upward toward the heart and the *kui* facing outward. After a long while, you will suddenly see within the *kui* a great spirit, clad and named as described in the invocation. You will also feel warmth in your navel as true qi arrives.

Then swallow saliva sixty times and click your teeth nine times. Raise your left hand’s third finger to press the *ren zhong* point below your nose, and softly recite the incantation:

*"Supreme Purple Emperor,
Radiant and resplendent at the central pivot,
Nine Wefts gleaming in luster,
Light surpassing the great aurora,
Myriad spirits look up in reverence,
A thousand dawns plant their roots,
Seven Degrees employed in brightness,
Nine Mists blooming in fragrance,
Governing Yang to manifest obedience,
Grasping Yin to achieve harmony,
True radiance opens the array,
Dark roots encompass all,
On this auspicious lunar day,
Come to shine within my navel,
Purple qi rising to the heavens,
Flying light descending in streams,
Refining my hun and po,
Flourishing essence and vital fluids,
Suddenly the great spirit appears,
Noble and divine in the Upper Palace,
Named *Zhu Meng*,
Styled *Liu Yu*,
Seated upright within the navel,
Riding the Nine Qi of the Dipper,
Exhaling and inhaling numinous fluids,
Balancing blood and regulating the stomach,
Yellow phoenix-feathered mantle,
Dragon robe and tiger belt,
Hands unlocking the sun’s root,
Head crowned with green hibiscus,
Waist ablaze with flowing fire,
Lightning’s brilliance illuminating the boundless,
Grant me flight as an immortal,
Treading the void and soaring aloft,
Ascending to the Jade Chamber,
Bearing the canopy of the celestial void,
Commanding the myriad spirits,
Heaven and Earth in shared repose."*

Upon concluding the invocation, swallow the saliva thirty times and click the teeth nine times. Repeat the invocation as before, and when finished, rise to face one’s life-star and bow twice. After bowing, open the eyes.

The practice of the Lower Prime’s Dao is now complete.

If the hands are raised with fingers interlaced, this occurs during the invocation; once the invocation ends, return the hands to their original position.

On the eight seasonal nodes at midnight, enter the chamber and sit upright. Interlace the hands, settle the qi, close the eyes, and inwardly visualize the entire body rising gently, ascending to fly into the Dipper’s *Kui* asterism. Persist in this visualization until sensing one’s form already within the Dipper. Focus intently, and when warmth is felt throughout the body, this is the true qi uniting with virtue.

Next, visualize the names, appearances, and colors of the Nine Essences and Three Spirits, their forms like newborn infants. The Three Spirits sit facing me, and I bow to them in my heart. Concentrate the vision until the body seems to dissolve into faintness, inducing a state of profound absorption.

Then swallow the saliva eighty times and click the teeth nine times. Raise the left hand to rest upon the heart and softly invoke:

*"Supreme Cinnabar Numinous,
Mysterious radiance blazing like a whirlwind,
Nine jades unlock the celestial pivot,
Luminous qi diffuses in clarity,
Purple dawn illumines the hidden,
Seven luminaries gleam resplendent,
Dual effulgences proclaim brightness,
Yin and Yang divide in harmony,
Four measures flourish in use,
Numinous fluids return in reflux,
Eight nodes awaken qi,
Ascending to the Nine Origins,
Grasping the Dipper’s handle,
I present myself to the Three Spirits.
They ask why I linger,
Why I have not yet ascended as an immortal.
I bow my head in awe before the Emperor,
Then grow majestic in might,
Mouth holding the sun’s root,
Left shattering the Six Heavens,
Right overseeing Mount Feng,
Flowing bells blaze above,
Ten thousand demons shatter and scatter.
Thus they know my po,
Strengthen my three hun,
Conceal the Dipper’s inner radiance within,
Nine Essences abide in the heart,
Purple auroras glow in mutual reflection,
Flying light spans ten thousand fathoms.
Harmonizing the hun and restraining the po,
Six wombs refine in balance,
Essence responds in transformation,
The Jade Consort suddenly appears,
Seated within my heart,
Gazing down and up in mutual regard.
Her name is *Mihua*,
Styled *Linqian*,
Exhaling and inhaling the dual qi,
Pacifying the hundred meridians.
Her body wears a mantle of refined light,
Phoenix radiance and simurgh skirts,
Tiger-scribed belt at the waist,
Dragon patterns in jade script,
Hands holding moon’s essence,
Head crowned with purple coronet.
Leaping into the Great Empyrean,
Riding the canopy of light,
Inscribed in the *Tai Su*,
I attain flight as an immortal,
Transcending the empty vastness,
Mounting the Jade Prime,
Ascending to the Crimson Chamber,
Commanding the myriad spirits,
Balancing the Two Measures,
Returning to infant visage.
The Northern Emperor’s lightning,
The Southern Emperor’s fire array,
The Azure Emperor’s kindled torch,
Dazzling thunder and lightning,
Western currents double-striking,
Resonant tones chanting in harmony,
Fourfold leaps propel me upward,
Recommending me to the Jade Perfected.
Thereupon I ride the Eight Effulgences,
Roaming and feasting amidst the Nine Mists."*

Upon concluding the invocation, swallow the saliva thirty times and click the teeth nine times. Repeat the invocation as before, then rise to face the northwest and bow twice. After bowing, open the eyes.

The practice of the Eight Nodes’ Perfection is now complete.

This Dao is the secret wonder of transcending emptiness, the marvelous method of the Nine Perfected. The practice is divided into three stages, with nine days of monthly cultivation—hence it is called the *Nine Perfected Ascending the Mysterious Writ*. It is a treasured text among the esoteric scriptures of the Supreme Perfected, the essential formula for attaining perfection.

When transmitting this to a worthy recipient, the receiver must first undergo a purification fast for one hundred days, or thirty days, or ten days, according to their capacity. Additionally, they should observe a one-day fast beforehand to cleanse their sincere heart. The transmitter must also fast in the same manner as the receiver. On the day of transmission, both parties shall first draw blood to consecrate the altar, cut their hair, and swear an oath of secrecy. Later sages, however, deemed blood sacrifice harmful to the vitality of living beings and hair-cutting a violation of bodily integrity. Thus, they substituted three taels of yellow gold for the blood oath and thirty-two feet of green silk for the hair-cutting pledge.

The master and disciple must not treat these oath objects as private possessions or misuse them; instead, they should be offered to reclusive Daoists dwelling in lofty mountains or to solitary, impoverished practitioners. If one has ascended to walk the void, the objects may be cast into mountain chambers or scattered upon sacred peaks. This is done to demonstrate that heavenly trust is profound and the Dao’s essence is prized above material wealth.

Those who violate these precepts will cause their seven generations of ancestors to suffer the trials of the Wind Blade in the Dark Capital, while their own souls shall become lowly ghosts. The transmission period, the method of bestowal, and all procedures must adhere strictly to the above regulations, with oath objects of the finest quality. The recipient’s heart must be pure and refined, their sincerity unwavering, and their devotion complete.

The transmitter is the master and guide, while the receiver is the disciple. Those who hear the Dao should look to the master as their model; those who seek life should dwell near the realm of life. Those who fail to uphold these teachings, who neglect or disrespect them, will cause their three generations of ancestors to be punished by the Fire Bureau, while they themselves shall be afflicted with lifelong ailments.

The Yellow Emperor once studied under the Master of Mount Jing, who knew only the method of refining stones—no other wonders—and was hardly superior to the Yellow Emperor. Yet because the Yellow Emperor inquired about the art of refining stones, he became his disciple. The Master of Mount Jing was a descendant of Lord You of Ji and now resides on Mount Weiyu. He can refine stones into water, boil water into jade, and grind jade into powder, which he consumes with stone water. Those who master this art may endure as long as heaven itself, yet they cannot soar through the empty void or grasp the morning mist in their hands. Though the art of refining stones is marvelous, it remains but a minor technique.

Here ends the *Supreme Perfected’s Scripture of Soaring on Wings: The Upper Record of the Nine Perfected Ascending the Mysterious*. The following section is the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected of the Supreme Perfected*. Though it contains an upper and lower sequence, its methods and applications differ and do not intersect.

The Central Yellow Lord of the Dao transmitted this to the Perfected of the Great Void, alongside the *Eight Esoteric Sayings*. The *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected* is practiced among humans and includes oral instructions, though the main text is too sacred to be written. Now, the prescribed methods are as follows:

**First Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 5th, 15th, 25th, 27th, and 29th days of the fifth month—five times in a month, all at dawn.

**Second Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 8th, 11th, 14th, 19th, 23rd, and 27th days of the eighth month—six times in a month, all at the hour of *chen* (7–9 AM).

**Third Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 6th, 7th, 17th, 18th, 25th, and 26th days of the sixth month—six times in a month, all at the hour of *si* (9–11 AM).

**Fourth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 2nd, 8th, 14th, 18th, 19th, and 28th days of the first month—six times in a month, all at noon.

**Fifth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 3rd, 8th, 13th, 20th, and 26th days of the third month—five times in a month, all at the hour of *wei* (1–3 PM).

**Sixth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 7th, 11th, 14th, 18th, 23rd, 25th, and 28th days of the seventh month—seven times in a month, all at the hour of *shen* (3–5 PM).

**Seventh Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 2nd, 6th, 9th, 13th, 16th, 19th, 23rd, and 27th days of the eleventh month—eight times in a month, all at the hour of *you* (5–7 PM).

**Eighth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 2nd, 7th, 9th, 15th, 18th, 19th, and 27th days of the second month—seven times in a month, all at the hour of *xu* or *hai* (7–11 PM).

**Ninth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 3rd, 9th, 17th, 19th, 26th, and 29th days of the twelfth month—six times in a month, all at midnight.

Here end the oral instructions of the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected*. These days and hours are when the qi of life converges and the essence of the Perfected aligns, making it most auspicious for visualization and readily invoking the mysterious response. If one dwells in seclusion atop lofty peaks, hidden among cloud-wreathed cliffs, severs all worldly ties, purifies the intestines by abstaining from grains, joins hands to rectify the heart, and meditates upon the morning’s essence, they should practice daily as prescribed in the original scripture.

However, as most people in the world are occupied with affairs and cannot cultivate in daily tranquility, the above schedule is provided. Practicing for fourteen years is sufficient to transcend the empty void, master life and death, pass through water and fire, ascend to the Supreme Clarity, cause the five viscera to blossom, and commune with heaven.

The *Upper Scroll of the Scripture of Ascending the Mysterious on Wings* requires three repetitions in a month, totaling nine days—this is due to the world’s lack of perfect stillness. If one maintains long fasts, embraces solitude, gazes upon the empty vastness, and focuses the heart beyond worldly matters, they should practice on these days in sequence.

A monthly practice of nine repetitions is merely for those still dwelling among worldly concerns. At the eight solar nodes, one should meditate upon the Dipper’s midst, and suddenly perceive the Jade Consort seated before them. The Jade Consort exhales purple mist into one’s mouth, and after a long while, her robes appear as invoked at the eight nodes. This woman is the yin spirit of the Nine Essences, the Supreme Clarity’s foremost consort.

This is the oral transmission of the Azure Lad.

Here ends the *Scripture of the Five Constants of the Supreme Clarity: Transformations and Myriad Changes in the Murky Depths*. #1 The character *nai* 乃 was originally written as *ji* 及.

chunks.original_text: 上清五常变通万化郁冥经 经名：上清五常变通万化郁冥经。 撰人不详。 系纂集《飞步空常诀》、《龙飞尺素诀》、《白羽黑翩灵飞玉符》、《飞行羽经九真升玄上记》四篇早期上清经诀而成。 一卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞玄部本文类。 上清五常变通万化郁冥经 太上大道君曰：空常者，天地之魂魄，阴阳之威明。 空者，九天之魂精； 常者，九地之魄灵。 其二炁则结成帝尊之大神，以威辅弼之焕明。 空常则以辅弼为瞻视，役运天光，察观万方，总录天宿，回化五常，召运摄会，促机转输。 天休地泰，则空常隐藏； 天否地激，则空常焕明。 吉凶报应，立告不祥，变化万气，改易阴阳，四时代谢，莫不由焉。 故二星尊贵，隐伏华晨，皆空常之妙趣，难可屡瞻也。 得见二星，延寿无穷，存修其道，飞升华堂，上真秘言，此之谓也。 上相青童君敢请问：空常之道，灵音妙贵，岂可闻乎。 太上大道君曰：空常者，天地之至名，而谓之无名，混而为一，是为有名。 但九天秘其灵音，不行於经文，既运辅弼为视听，倚光景以通真，帝尊禀之以致治，学者御之以致仙，使有心者求之於无测，因复名之为有名。 有名而不传於莽莽之徒，莫能测焉，好尚者而不获其真也，如此岂复为劝学之宗者哉。 然九天有命，唯宿有玄图玉字，方诸刻简，来生合真之人，得参隐名。 君当总掌群方，试校万仙，理定幽微，拯救兆民，不得冒禁相告，子当秘焉。 於是君便登云景之上丹灵朱房，清斋三月，裂帛告灵，金羊银雁，礼天受真。 道君告曰：九天有禁，依格万劫一传，令运度交周，气反上清，道应行於今。 一依玄科，七百年中有其人听三传，自无其挺，封还九天，或付名山九洞之室，轻泄漏慢，责及七祖，摙汲溟波以灌四渎，担负诸山以填河海，此祸福报应，无一差失也。 子明审此言，慎而行焉。 凡欲步空常，飞纲以逃形变景，飞行玉清，当以一月七过行之，八节、六丁日，亦行其道。 至其日，入室烧香左右，敷置图席，南向叩齿二十四通，闭目思五星焕明五方，良久，来下入己身五藏之中。 金星入肺宫，土星入脾宫，火星入心宫，木星入肝宫，水星入肾宫。 五星光明，洞照五藏，觉体熏热，便思五星皇夫人及二十五点空常晨君，姓讳衣服，各在其方。 都毕，而微祝曰： 金木水火土，总统四元，玄精流映，光照五门，中有五皇夫人灵君，二十五点空常天尊，变化形影，千合万分，降入五藏，结成玉仙，炼我七魄，育我三魂，举形上升，飞入斗门，遨戏上都，五星齐群，今日玄庆，请如所陈。 毕，引星光炁二十五咽止。 便起登纲也。

**The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Five Constants’ Transformations and Myriad Changes in the Murky Darkness**

**Scripture Title:** *The Supreme Clarity Scripture of the Five Constants’ Transformations and Myriad Changes in the Murky Darkness*. Author unknown. Compiled from four early Supreme Clarity scriptural formulas: *The Flying Steps of the Void Constant Formula*, *The Dragon-Soaring Silk Measure Formula*, *The Jade Talisman of the Spirit-Flight with White Feathers and Black Wings*, and *The Nine Perfected’s Ascension to the Mysterious Record of the Flying Feather Scripture*. One scroll. Base text from *The Orthodox Daoist Canon*, *Cavern Mystery Section*, *Scriptural Writings Category*.

---

The Most High Lord of the Great Dao said: The Void Constant is the hun-soul and po-soul of Heaven and Earth, the majestic brilliance of yin and yang. The Void is the hun-essence of the Nine Heavens; the Constant is the po-spirit of the Nine Earths. Their two qi congeal to form the great spirit of the Imperial Honored One, whose radiance aids and illuminates. The Void Constant, with its aiding brilliance as its gaze, commands the movement of celestial light, surveys the ten thousand directions, records the celestial lodges, revolves the Five Constants, summons and directs gatherings, and hastens the turning of mechanisms. When Heaven is at rest and Earth at peace, the Void Constant conceals itself; when Heaven is in decline and Earth in turmoil, the Void Constant shines forth. Fortune and misfortune, omens and portents—it instantly reports all inauspicious signs. The transformations of the myriad qi, the alterations of yin and yang, the succession of the four seasons—none occur without its agency. Thus, the two stars are revered and noble, hidden within the splendor of dawn, their wondrous subtlety belonging to the Void Constant, rarely to be glimpsed. Those who behold the two stars gain boundless longevity; those who cultivate and preserve this Dao ascend in flight to the Hall of Splendor. This is the secret teaching of the Highest Perfected.

The Prime Minister, the Azure Lad, respectfully inquired: The Dao of the Void Constant is spiritually resonant and wondrously noble—may it be heard?

The Most High Lord of the Great Dao said: The Void Constant is the supreme name of Heaven and Earth, yet it is called the Nameless. Blended into one, it becomes the Named. However, the Nine Heavens guard its spiritual resonance, which does not circulate in scriptural texts. Since it employs its aiding brilliance for seeing and hearing, relying on light and shadow to communicate with the real, the Imperial Honored One receives it to govern, and scholars wield it to attain immortality. It causes those with intention to seek it in the unfathomable, and thus it is again named the Named. Though named, it is not transmitted to the reckless; none can fathom it. Those who esteem it yet fail to attain its truth—how could this serve as the foundation for encouraging study? Yet the Nine Heavens have decreed that only those destined to possess the Dark Chart and Jade Characters, inscribed on the Fangzhu and bamboo slips, and those born to unite with the real, may partake of its hidden name. You shall oversee the myriad regions, examine the ten thousand immortals, settle the subtle and obscure, and deliver the countless people. You must not rashly disclose it in violation of the prohibitions—guard it well.

Thereupon, the Azure Lad ascended to the Vermilion Chamber of the Cinnabar Spirit above the clouds, purified himself for three months, tore silk to invoke the spirits, and with golden sheep and silver geese, paid homage to Heaven to receive the real. The Lord of the Dao declared: The Nine Heavens have strictures—according to the rules, it is transmitted once in ten thousand kalpas. Now, as the cycles intersect and qi returns to Supreme Clarity, the Dao is to be practiced in this era. Follow the dark statutes: within seven hundred years, there may be one who hears the three transmissions. If none are worthy, seal it and return it to the Nine Heavens, or entrust it to the chambers of the Nine Caves in the famous mountains. To lightly divulge or neglect it brings retribution upon the seven generations: drawing from the dark waves to irrigate the Four Rivers, bearing the weight of the mountains to fill the seas and oceans. This karmic response of fortune and misfortune leaves no room for error. You must clearly heed these words and act with caution.

Whenever one wishes to tread the Void Constant, flying the net to escape form and transform appearance, and soaring into the Jade Clarity, one should practice this seven times in a month. On the Eight Nodes and the Six Ding days, one may also perform this Dao. On the appointed day, enter the chamber, burn incense to the left and right, arrange the mat and diagram, face south, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Close the eyes and visualize the Five Stars shining brilliantly in the five directions. After a long while, let them descend and enter the five viscera within one’s body: the Metal Star into the Lung Palace, the Earth Star into the Spleen Palace, the Fire Star into the Heart Palace, the Wood Star into the Liver Palace, and the Water Star into the Kidney Palace. The Five Stars’ radiance illuminates the five viscera, and one feels the body suffused with warmth. Then visualize the Five August Ladies of the Stars and the Twenty-Five Celestial Lords of the Void Constant’s Dawn, recalling their surnames, personal names, and attire, each in their respective direction.

When all is complete, softly recite the prayer:
*Metal, Wood, Water, Fire, Earth—*
*Together they govern the Four Origins.*
*The dark essence flows and reflects,*
*Illuminating the Five Gates.*
*Within reside the Five August Ladies and Spirit Lords,*
*The Twenty-Five Celestial Lords of the Void Constant,*
*Transforming shapes and shadows,*
*Uniting in thousands, dividing in myriad ways.*
*Descend into the five viscera,*
*Congeal to form Jade Immortals.*
*Refine my seven po,*
*Nurture my three hun.*
*Raise my form to ascend,*
*Fly into the Dipper’s Gate.*
*Roam and play in the Upper Capital,*
*The Five Stars gathered as one.*
*Today, in this dark celebration,*
*I request that all be as recited.*

Afterward, draw in the star-light qi twenty-five times and swallow it. Then rise and ascend the net.

Standing with feet together upon the Star of Great White, hold the breath for seven cycles, then face west and softly recite the prayer:

*Seven Gates of the West,*
*White qi flies in radiance.*
*Above dwells the Luminous Emperor,*
*the Bright August of Lesser Yin.*
*His name is Golden Supreme Essence,*
*robed in feathered garments.*
*Resplendent essence flows and reflects,*
*illuminating the Golden Palace.*
*Named the Five Points,*
*ancestral of the Void Constant,*
*he bears the talisman and raises the standard,*
*summoning yin and seizing yang,*
*transforming water and fire across seventy-four directions.*
*Grant me flying steps,*
*concealing my form to enter the void,*
*driving the white chariot,*
*roaming the cloud chambers.*
*May heaven and earth endure,*
*eternally without end.*

*Internally replete, externally overflowing,*

chunks.original_text: 元常五黄，中皇大神，变化七金，威伏三辰，逃身分形，上天入云，总呼五灵，卫我脾门，使我藏府，早化成仙，飞玄入空，水火万原，在意所欲，上升无间，得与皇妃，结友齐群。 毕，引气十二咽止。 次从土星三步，登火星，并足，上第一空常上，祝曰： 空常至灵，辅弼上真，入我绛宫，总摄万仙。 次上第二河常上，祝曰： 河常逃伏，隐遁八冥，水火变化，使我仙成。 次上第三元常上，祝曰： 元常变化，草木蔽身，使我形影，同合道真。 次上第四古常上，祝曰： 古常天双，出入无间，身生羽翮，飞升上天。 次上第五巳常上，祝曰： 巳常南离，建九自覆，变化成形，立成呜兽。 步五常毕，还火星上，闭气三息，叩齿三通，而祝曰： 流炎丹灵，三门电庭，五常变通，万化郁冥，摄命土皇，威制北精，上元保录，固我长生，今日步空，乘虚入星，荧惑辅心，我道洞明，千分万合，所向立成，魂导魄炼，羽服时生，得与五星，擭舆玉清。 毕，引气三咽止，次从火星九步，取木星，并足，登九常上，祝曰： 九常青皇，天地魂根，使我变化，逃景隐山。 次上世常上，祝曰： 世常天灵，总度万仙，使我步空，合景成神。 次上明常上，祝曰： 明常昭昭，光曜八眦，使我变形，逃水成地。 次上五常上，祝曰： 五常威化，制御五土，使我化形，立住成虎。 次上法常上，祝曰： 法常彰木，位总神仙，使我分景，化身为千。 步五常毕，还木星上，闭气九息，叩齿九通，而祝曰： 少阳九门，徘徊青天，中有五常，变化亿千，呼阴召阳，制御金神，东华命节，坐应自然，步空蹑虚，策驾青姻，上降碧灵，下镇肝门，道明九合，立致飞仙，得与青皇，同真木晨。 毕，引气九咽止。 次从木星五步，取水星，并足，登阴常上，祝曰： 阴常北玄，万化之宗，使我住此，立成神龙。 次上黄常上，祝曰： 黄常灵阴，化为玉女，使我分形，立为百己。 次上定常上，祝曰： 定常总元，变化郁勃，使我分形，以成万物。 次上飞常上，祝曰： 飞常入空，上下百韵，化形六畜，使人不见。 次上六常上，祝曰： 六常纲纽，制鬼御神，回转天地，当之杀人。 步五常毕，还水星上，闭气五息，叩齿五通，祝曰： 北玄五气，五门开张，中星黑皇，号曰五常，变化幽冥，出阴入阳，召命三晨，制御土官，使我飞步，逃景太空，在所适向，分形百方，上造钩陈，升身玉京，体生奇毛，肾府纳芳，今日行道，神仙之宗，得天上愿，享祚无穷。 毕，引气五咽止。 如此步二十五点常都竟，便下，从门叩齿三十六通，向纲而歌三洞飞步章，九步登阳明星也。 并足，上阳明星上，东向祝曰： 太上宫中，变隐遁元，内妃大神，太一上尊，总领命籍，为我致言，藏形逃己，上升帝轩。 次上阴精星上，东北向祝曰： 中元宫中，保胎化形，内嫔太真，高上玄灵，斩胞解结，炼胎固精，变化万方，使我长生。 次上弼星上，向真人星祝曰： 真元官中，六遁七隐，上元玄母，育我胎产，遁化金室，变成苍辇，使我飞空，长年无限。 次上玄冥星上，向北祝曰： 纽幽宫中，匿景藏光，中元内妃，神仙大宗，度我六戊，出我八方，逃迹飞步，上超帝房。 次上丹元星上，西向祝曰：

chunks.original_text: 纲神宫中，变体易景，斗中大女，玄化无像，度我元斗，书名帝榜，飞空策虚，腾身浮影。 次上北极星上，东北向祝曰： 纪明宫中，隐迹散众，斗中中女，灵化上宫，落我玄籍，度名诸方，分身成千，反容婴童。 次上天关星上，向西北祝曰： 关会宫中，分景万形，斗中少女，玄上大灵，随斗运机，总输万生，使我飞空，变化太冥。 次上辅星上，向天门叩齿九通，祝曰： 帝席上宫，右皇夫人，上对帝君，齐景合真，号曰妙常，变化九天，运导日月，聚气成姻，回转水火，万怪潜身，是时元吉，玄庆敷陈，使我飞步，乘常入真，九晨流落，享福万千，形齐天光，德同三便。 毕，仰咽气二十四过止。 次上弼星上，向地户叩齿九通，祝曰： 上尊上宫，夫人右皇，帝尊同符，合灵华房，天魂地魄，号曰上空，变化九气，万真祖宗，回金转石，与天齐功， 化消山河 ，呼云召龙，万怪立灭，分景亿通，飞步蹑虚，流焕四冲，藏身魁席，覆衣天光，长灵天地，享庆洋洋，请如所愿，受福永终。 毕，仰咽三十六过止。 如此皆一过行之，不往反也。

soaring through the void and riding the emptiness,
ascending in body to cast no shadow.

face northeast and recite the prayer:
Within the Palace of the Bright Record,
concealing my traces and dispersing the multitudes,
the Middle Maiden within the Dipper,
numinous transformation of the Upper Palace,
striking my name from the Mysterious Register,
inscribing it through all directions,
dividing my body into a thousand,
returning my countenance to that of an infant.

face northwest and recite the prayer:
Within the Palace of the Converging Pass,
splitting my radiance into ten thousand forms,
the Youngest Maiden within the Dipper,
great numen of the Mysterious Upper Realm,
following the Dipper’s revolving mechanism,
governing the myriad lives,
granting me to fly through the void,
transforming into the Great Obscurity.
