face the Gate of Heaven, knock the teeth nine times, and recite the prayer:
Within the Upper Palace of the Imperial Couch,
the August Consort of the Right,
facing the Imperial Lord above,
aligning her radiance with the True,
named the Wondrous Constancy,
transforming through the Nine Heavens,
guiding and conveying the sun and moon,
gathering qi to form mist,
revolving water and fire,
concealing the myriad anomalies within,
at this time of primordial auspiciousness,
proclaiming the Mysterious Blessing,
granting me to fly in steps,
riding the Constant to enter the True,
the Nine Dawns flowing and scattering,
enjoying ten thousand blessings,
my form equaling the radiance of heaven,
my virtue harmonizing with the Three Conveniences.

face the Earthly Door, knock the teeth nine times, and recite the prayer:

heavenly hun and earthly po,

chunks.original_text: 须臾，众神钦然合变为一小儿，如始生之状，名曰无常童子，字曰变化神王，手执九星、五星，缨络一身，带日衔月。 童子以日月星光，以映熏兆身，身在赤光之内，表裹洞彻，则为混合万变之道。 仍仰咽气九过，而祝曰： 周天大神，号曰帝皇，回转九道，精焕八方，洞天流曜，发芒散光，隐沦绝冥，回合紫房，改化万形，结成灵童，流降内外，玉真四冲，左命火铃，右激电光，云雾郁勃，华文骞扬，太一神化，锦帔华裳，衔日戴月，身佩天章，飞回五晨，促转斗纲，适心纵己，在意所通，上天入冥，变化百方，保养我身，天地齐功，身生羽服，飞升帝宫。 毕，仰咽气九过止。 洞思九真五晨之道，隐沦八冥，事极於此矣。 金星五点，第一点姓地常，讳罂育，字通勃，真名逃九元。 第二点姓育常，讳焕通，字幽元，真名入五道。 第三点姓卯常，讳金上，字浩淳，真名代六形。 第四点姓流常，讳谷清，字逃边，真名转三关。 第五点姓行常，讳浩逃，字去斗，真名服气精。 右西方太白星之五常，并建素梁宝冠，衣素锦飞衣，手执金符玉节，主七门变化。 土星第一点，姓上常，讳黄光，字元胤，真名逃皇元。 第二点姓天常，讳寥电，字卓度，真名入木精。 第三点姓名常，讳空脁，字霞玄，真名变水火。 第四点姓三常，讳滕旻，字灵变，真名金上生。 第五点姓辰常，讳内溢，字益微，真名黑来谷。 右中央镇星五常之隐名，并建黄梁宝冠，衣黄锦飞衣，手执黄麾命魔之章，主十二门变化。 火星第一点，姓空常，讳常阳，字元无，真名灵通冥。 第二点姓河常，讳流精，字七转，真名七神会。 第三点姓元常，讳南皓，字精极，真名入流光。 第四点姓古常，讳洞主，字微生，真名变三神。 第五点姓巳常，讳季行，字后化，真名逃形边。 右南方荧惑星五常，并建朱粱宝冠，衣朱锦飞衣，手执赤神召灵之章，主三门变化。 木星第一点，姓九常，讳青芒，字上阳，真名隐真身。 第二点姓世常，讳苍元，字长命，真名通九道。 第三点姓明常，讳碧渊，字洞生，真名化青光。 第四点姓五常，讳归青，字玉阳，真名流电衡。 第五点姓法常，讳绿台，字明暧，真名万真会。 右东方岁星五常，并建青梁宝冠，衣青锦飞衣，手执青帝制魔之章，主九门变化。 水星第一点，姓阴常，讳玄通，字子元，真名北上元。 第二点姓黄常，讳曰空，字冬冥，真名动天众。 第三点姓定常，讳隐阳，字勃光，真名轮大劫。 第四点姓飞常，讳上元，字藏光，真名定万神。 第五点姓六常，讳终变，字分图，真名入黑关。 右北方辰星五常，并建玄梁宝冠，衣玄锦飞衣，手执北官摄杀之麾，主五门变化。 修行空常变化之道，常以八节及本命之日，正中入室，南向叩齿十二通，闭目思空常二神，及二十五点常之隐名衣服，各在其方，分明罗列在星宫之中，光明流焕，玄映兆身。 良久，忽化为凤凰、玄龟二兽，从天中来下，凤凰乘赤气之光，下兆头上； 玄龟乘白气之光，下兆两脚下。 凤凰从兆泥丸中入，玄龟从兆命门下入，赤白二气交络兆一身，觉己形化成凤凰，立玄龟之上，在赤白二气之中。 便叩齿二十五通，咽气二十五过，而仰祝曰： 天精地灵，号曰空常，北入五气，南制三阳，木生流火，七气折伤，水灌九震，中元不行，土王养金，木气伏藏，金符命灵，太帝扶迎，六戊逃己，隐影冥乡，太一护肺，金镇肾肠，上元辅心，炼仙肝宫，内鲜外荣，玉真四充，变化万景，混合二光，灵凤玄龟，神兽来迎，洞虚入微，形魂同翔，千变万化，适意所行，束西南北，莫不扶将，长保天地，享福无央，得与明皇，同游上京。

In his hands he holds the Nine Stars and Five Stars, their tassels adorning his entire body, bearing the sun and moon in his sash and mouth. The youth bathes your form in the radiance of sun, moon, and stars, your body enveloped in crimson light, inwardly and outwardly luminous and transparent—this is the Dao of the Myriad Transformations in Unity. Then, raising your head, swallow qi nine times and recite the incantation:

*"Great spirits of the celestial circuit,
Titled August Emperors,
Revolving the Nine Paths,
Essence blazing through the eight directions,
Luminous radiance streaming through the heavens,
Shooting forth rays and scattering light,
Concealed and dissolved in the profound,
Revolving to unite in the Purple Chamber,
Transforming myriad forms,
Congealing into the numinous youth,
Flowing within and without,
Jade Perfected of the four cardinals,
Left wielding the Fire Bell of Destiny,
Right striking the lightning’s flash,
Clouds and mists surging,
Resplendent patterns soaring,
Divine transformations of the Great One,
Brocade mantle and luminous robes,
Holding the sun and wearing the moon,
Adorned with celestial insignia,
Soaring through the Five Mornings,
Urging the turning of the Dipper’s net,
Following the heart’s desire,
Wherever the will extends,
Ascending to heaven, entering the obscure,
Transforming in a hundred ways,
Preserving and nurturing my body,
Heaven and earth sharing the merit,
My body sprouting feathered raiment,
Ascending to fly in the imperial palace."*

Following the will’s intent,

chunks.original_text: 毕，引气二咽止。 此空常隐沦之道，玄微理妙，事极於此。 所谓变化万方，身生水火，迥合天地，适意所求者矣。 子得之者，位加仙公，北辰书名，南宫记籍，五星下降，万神侍卫，福德自然，无求傍力。 修之九年，立致飞行，上步天宿，游宴玉清。 学无此法，便绝望於遐思，无损神於寝夕矣。 上天禁书，轻泄漏慢，罪及九祖父母，己身卒亡，长闭鬼官。 龙飞九道尺素隐诀 太上大道君，以上皇元年二月一日甲子，於无量天告盟，传度飞行羽经空常变化隐文，以付北极真公。 时九天上帝高仙大圣，并临盟场，五帝束带，万灵侍轩，日月吐晖，众星列精，七元开关，黄道不行，天地停机，三界肃清，绛霞随荫，紫云四骞，时和日庆，八景敷陈。 道君裂帛华晨之下，授诀金口之中，发言九天，遥唱命讳，上帝称欣，天真稽首，魔王束形，保举玄虚，位登玉清。 命五老监试，四司辅真，左右侍仙，分盟告灵，依俯仰之格，北向祝曰： 寒非登场，上命九灵，运度推移，日月不停，是时告晨，赤心解形，衔刀南官，噏丹寒庭，金羊银疡，礼献上清，裂素分经，告盟干天，请如四极，万劫一传，有泄我言，祸罚七玄，有愆我盟，考灭尔形，生死谢责，长闭幽冥。 毕，於是裂素度经，口授秘言。 天真下降，五帝卫灵，九晨给以金晨玉童九百人，九皇给以玉华玉女七百人，五皇又给五帝玉女各五百人。 五老命驾，四司仗幡，紫云飞耕十二琼输，前导凤歌，后从天钧，六师启路，九龙翼辕，以迎於真公。 上登玉清北辰上宫，遨宴七元，回旋五宿，历步天关，位登总仙，治於北极广灵之宫。 至开皇上年，以文付东华青童大君，依格万劫一传。 龙飞尺素之道，出於九天上帝，以载天地九晨五星空常之名。 高上宝秘灵音，故为盟文，自非前生九万劫逆注玄简，录字上清，应为真人者，不得盻其篇目，参其隐音也。 得见此文，生死成仙，能修其道，则神光流映，帝皇下降，七年隐沦，变化百方，出入幽冥，浮景九空。 十四年白日登晨，飞升玉清。 有宗大经，但朝礼神真，则致长生，延寿无穷，千祸不干，万凶不当，兵灾珍息，触向皆成，出入则致九皇垂应，项映圆光，五帝营卫，所向司迎，克得奉侍圣君於上清宫。 此道与元始俱生，九元虚皇以传太上大道君，大道君以传后圣金阙帝君，及太帝君、太微天帝君、北极真公，使付束华青童大君。 依格万劫一传於后学得道之人。 传度之法，受者依科实信，绛纹缯九十尺，五色纹缯各五十尺，诣有经之师，对斋百日，或七十日，或七日。 於玄岳立坛高寂之地，书文北向分盟度诀。 以金羊五两告五星，银鸦九两告九晨，二物礼天受经，奉师效心。 子时露於坛场之上，以绛纹之巾盛羊着东，白纹之巾盛雁着西，告誓九天，分盟各半，口度秘名。 临度之时，亦依上祝之法。 可谓宝道贵真，誓不泄漏之盟。 若无盟轻传，师及弟子同考灭身，七祖充责，万劫不原。 上天之禁，宜各审详。 登盟之时，弟子执羊雁，北向九拜，次五方各一拜，西起，竟南还西，伏东向，置羊鸦於师左右。 师於中央，北向叩齿九道，称： 某岳真人臣某甲，敢以良时上吉，三合喜辰，谨登皇坛，披形赤心，清斋歃丹，列盟于天。

When finished, draw in the qi and swallow twice, then stop.
This is the Dao of the Ever-Concealed, the profound and subtle principle of wondrous workings, wherein all matters culminate.
Herein lies the myriad transformations, the body generating water and fire, merging with heaven and earth in perfect accord, fulfilling every intent and desire.
Those who attain this shall ascend to the rank of Immortal Duke, their names inscribed by the Northern Asterism, their records kept in the Southern Palace.
The Five Stars shall descend, ten thousand spirits shall serve as guards, and blessings and virtue shall arise naturally, requiring no external aid.
After nine years of cultivation, one shall attain flight, ascend to the celestial lodgings, and wander in revelry through the Jade Purity.
Without this method, all distant aspirations shall be cut off, and the spirit shall suffer no rest by night or day.

This is a celestial forbidden scripture. To lightly disclose or profane it brings guilt upon nine generations of ancestors and parents, while the offender’s own body shall perish abruptly, forever confined to the ghostly bureaus.

**The Hidden Essentials of the Dragon’s Flight on Nine-Path Silk**

The Most High Lord of the Great Dao, in the first year of the Supreme August Emperor’s reign, on the first day of the second month (a *jiǎzǐ* day), proclaimed an oath in the Heaven of Infinite Vastness, transmitting the *Feathered Scripture of Flight and the Ever-Concealed Transformations* to the Perfected Lord of the Northern Culmen.
At that time, the Nine Heavens’ Celestial Emperor, the Lofty Immortals, and the Great Sages all attended the oath ceremony. The Five Emperors wore sashes, ten thousand spirits stood in attendance, the sun and moon radiated their splendor, the host of stars arrayed their essence, the Seven Origins opened the gates, the Yellow Path ceased its motion, heaven and earth paused their mechanisms, and the Three Realms grew solemn and clear.
Crimson clouds cast their shade, purple mists soared on all sides, the time was harmonious, the day auspicious, and the Eight Sceneries unfolded in full.
Beneath the radiant dawn, the Lord of the Dao tore the silk and imparted the secret within his golden mouth. His words resounded through the Nine Heavens, and from afar he intoned the sacred name.
The Celestial Emperor rejoiced, the Heavenly Perfected bowed their heads, the demon kings restrained their forms, and they pledged to uphold the Mysterious Void. Thus, the Perfected Lord ascended to the Jade Purity.

The Five Elders were commanded to oversee the trial, the Four Directors to assist the Perfected, and the attending immortals to the left and right to divide the oath and proclaim it to the spirits.
Following the prescribed form of reverence, they faced north and intoned:
*"It is not for common ascent that we gather. By the mandate of the Nine Spirits, the revolutions shift ceaselessly, the sun and moon never halt. At this dawn hour, with sincere hearts and unbound forms, we hold the blade in the Southern Palace, inhale the cinnabar in the Cold Court.
The golden ram and silver crow are offered in homage to the Supreme Purity. The silk is torn to divide the scripture, and the oath is sworn before heaven. We beseech the Four Poles: let this be transmitted but once in ten thousand kalpas.
Should any betray these words, calamity shall strike the Seven Mysteries. Should any violate this covenant, their form shall be extinguished, their life and death forfeit, and they shall be eternally confined to the dark nether realms."*

When finished, the silk was torn to transmit the scripture, and the secret words were imparted orally.
The Heavenly Perfected descended, the Five Emperors guarded the spirit, the Nine Dawns bestowed nine hundred golden dawn lads and jade maidens, the Nine August Ones bestowed seven hundred jade flower maidens, and the Five August Ones further bestowed five hundred jade maidens each from the Five Emperors.
The Five Elders commanded their chariots, the Four Directors wielded their banners, twelve jade chariots of purple clouds flew in tandem, phoenix songs led the way, and celestial chimes followed behind.
The Six Masters cleared the path, nine dragons flanked the carriage, and thus they welcomed the Perfected Lord.
Ascending to the Northern Asterism’s Upper Palace of Jade Purity, he roamed and feasted among the Seven Origins, circled the Five Lodgings, traversed the Celestial Passes, and attained the rank of Supreme Immortal, governing the Palace of Vast Spirit in the Northern Culmen.
In the Supreme August Era, the text was transmitted to the Great Lord of the Eastern Florescence, the Azure Lad, to be passed on once in ten thousand kalpas according to the prescribed form.

The Dao of the Dragon’s Flight on Silk emerges from the Nine Heavens’ Celestial Emperor, bearing the names of the Nine Dawns, Five Stars, and the Ever-Concealed of heaven and earth.
As the precious, secret, numinous sound, it serves as the oath text. Unless one’s name was inscribed in the Mysterious Register of the Supreme Purity in a former life—having reversed the flow of ninety thousand kalpas—one shall not glimpse its passages or fathom its hidden tones.
Those who behold this text shall achieve immortality in life or death. Those who cultivate its Dao shall radiate divine light, and the Celestial Emperor shall descend. After seven years of concealment, they shall transform in a hundred ways, traversing the nether realms and floating through the Nine Void Heavens.
After fourteen years, they shall ascend at dawn and fly to the Jade Purity.
This is the great scripture of the ancestral lineage. By merely paying homage to the divine Perfected, one shall attain longevity, prolong life without end, repel a thousand calamities, and avert ten thousand misfortunes. Weapons shall be stilled, and all endeavors shall prosper.
When one goes forth, the Nine August Ones shall respond, a halo shall encircle their neck, and the Five Emperors shall provide guard. Wherever they turn, the directors shall welcome them, enabling them to serve the Sage Lord in the Palace of Supreme Purity.
This Dao existed coevally with the Primordial Beginning. The Nine Origins’ Void Sovereign transmitted it to the Most High Lord of the Great Dao, who passed it to the Later Sage, the Golden Portal Emperor Lord, as well as the Supreme Emperor Lord, the Celestial Emperor of the Grand Tenuity, and the Perfected Lord of the Northern Culmen, who entrusted it to the Great Lord of the Eastern Florescence, the Azure Lad.
According to the prescribed form, it is transmitted once in ten thousand kalpas to those among later learners who attain the Dao.

The method of transmission requires the recipient to be sincere and steadfast, offering ninety feet of crimson silk and fifty feet each of five-colored silk. They must seek a master who possesses the scripture and observe a hundred-day retreat—or seventy days, or seven days.
Upon a secluded altar on the Mysterious Peak, they shall face north to divide the oath and transmit the secret.
Five taels of golden ram are offered to the Five Stars, and nine taels of silver crow to the Nine Dawns. These two offerings are presented to heaven upon receiving the scripture, and the disciple pledges devotion to the master.
At the *zǐ* hour, the offerings are exposed upon the altar: the ram wrapped in crimson silk placed to the east, the crow wrapped in white silk placed to the west.
They swear the oath before the Nine Heavens, divide the silk, and orally transmit the secret names. At the moment of transmission, they follow the same prayer as above.
This is the precious Dao of the noble Perfected, an oath never to be betrayed. Without such an oath, any careless transmission shall bring the master and disciple alike to annihilation, their seven generations of ancestors condemned, and their souls unredeemed for ten thousand kalpas.
The prohibitions of heaven demand careful consideration.

When ascending the altar, the disciple holds the ram and crow, faces north, and bows nine times. Then, they bow once to each of the five directions, beginning in the west, circling to the south, and ending in the west, prostrating to the east and placing the ram and crow to the master’s left and right.
The master stands at the center, faces north, and knocks his teeth nine times, declaring:
*"I, the Perfected Minister of [Name] Peak, [Personal Name], dare, at this auspicious time of triple conjunction, ascend the imperial altar, bare my form and sincere heart, purify my fast, and partake of cinnabar. I array this oath before heaven."*

May the blessings of past lives extend deeply into future rebirths, the wheel of fortune turning without cease across the Nine Heavens. The jade essence of the flying immortals guided the mist, the host of spirits guarded the numinous, their luminous presence suffusing the Nine Empyreans, resplendent in the courtyard of the Jade Void. They descended upon the Mystic Mound of the Supreme Perfected to transmit the precious scriptures.

On that day, as the Supreme Perfected Lord completed his fast in the Upper Clarity, the Celestial Emperor of the Great Thearch, the Three Pure Primordial Ladies of the Purple Tenuity, the Heavenly Emperor, the Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity, and the august guests of the Lofty Jade Sovereign all descended together. They kindled incense of a hundred harmonies, arrayed the floating banners of the five-colored spirit officials, and took their jade seats in the Purple Palace. The assembled immortals circumambulated the scriptures thrice, whereupon the Three Pure Primordial Ladies rose, faced west, and intoned in a voice of mystic clarity the *Ode of Celebration for the Feathered Writ*, extolling the divine scriptures. A numinous wind scatters rare fragrance..."*

chunks.original_text: 萧萧玄景上，微飙翼太阳。 素鸾迅飞凤，口衔神羽章。 翻翮振九霄，悲呜焕玄梁。 妙诀乘空发，清治道未央。 群真并称庆，稽首礼玉皇。 诵毕，太帝君又起立北向，诵曰： 玄凤迅云翮，白鸾欣踌躇。 飞香和芳花，流星耀云衢。 巨虹控长辔，飞仙互相扶。 万真庆嘉吉，欣凤虚中游。 元始本无迹，玄感自相求。 振羽不待驾，飘飘乘姻浮。 宝章综玄纲，五体御灵符。 称庆礼福庭，旋香各三周。 诵毕，天帝君起立东向，又诵曰： 素羽斑玄翩，乘浮落运回。 流香溢十天，芳芝郁太微。 灵章启幽机，羽经朗玄辉。 至道本无赜，持真景白飞。 於是诵毕。 太真丈人身建法服，冠极天无量三宝玉冠，衣无缝九色飞云耀光羽章，左佩流铃，右带七元，正南向而伏。 太微天帝君，起命羽仙侍郎擎执金案，承经北向长立，以授於太真。 众仙咸称善，太真长立授经，面发金光，五体即生自然灵飞玉符，登携众真，共登白鸾之车，驾黑翮之凤，以宴常阳东之豪林碧水之境，扶桑之墟九源之口，西游玄羽素野之域蒙汜之滨，南造朱陵极炎之精南夏之邑，北到朔阴洞玄之馆寒水之乡，中盘十绝黄气阳精太玄玉京金台玉室丹琼之宫。 游朗十天，八域洞清，总领亿真，无天不系，无幽不关，无气不统，无仙不摄，普御群神，自天以下，莫不范德於太真，仰宗於羽经也。 於是帝君各浮玄官，经劫七千，传於太上大道君焉。 上灵飞玉符玄仙羽精自然之章，佩之七年，乘空飞行，上登七元。 修羽经飞步之道，无此符则不得乘虚升玄也。 受者青锦九十尺盟天。 登修之日，书左手掌心，即能握碧霞而飞行。 书青缯九寸，佩之左肘，六甲十二神，灵飞玉女十二人侍左。 下灵飞玉符元始羽精玄玉之章，佩之七年，乘空飞行，上登五星。 行飞步升玄之道，无此符则不得乘空而行也。 受者素锦六十尺盟天。 登修之日，书右手掌心，则能握素霞而飞行。 书白缯九寸，佩之右肘，六甲十二神，灵飞玉女十二人侍右。 左灵飞玉符玄气始生之精素羽之章，佩之九年，乘空飞行，上登五星。 行飞步升玄之道，无此符则不得蹑云玄升也。 受者丹锦八十尺盟天。 登修之日，书左足跖心，即能蹑空飞行。 书绛缯九寸，佩之左肘，六甲十二神，灵飞玉女十二人侍前。 右灵飞玉符元气之精升玄羽章，佩之九年，得乘飞云，行步玉清。 修飞步之道，无此符不得蹑於七元而升虚也。 受者玄锦五十尺盟天。 登修之日，书右足取心，即能步玄飞行。 书皂缯九寸，佩之右肘，六甲十二神，灵飞玉女十二人侍后。 太灵飞玉符阳气黄精飞行羽章，佩之九年，面生金光，坐在立亡，飞行太空。 修飞步之道，无此符则不得仰登星魁，超升九玄。 受者黄锦十二尺盟天。 登修之日，书符於心前，即能吐气成云，乘云飞行。 书黄缯九寸，佩之左肘，六甲十二神，灵飞玉女十二人侍身。 凡修行存思七星之道，入室皆先服五符，然后书也。 书及服符，皆东向叩齿十二通，仰祝曰： 玄虚紫清，飞行羽经，上映云宫，下摄千灵，控御六甲，运我身形，飞步天纲，上攀斗精，凝魂固魄，内镇充盈，出空入玄，与气常生。 毕，服符并书五心，然后行事。 如此九年，克得乘空御云，飞行太清。 左右灵飞玉符，出於自然之气，传授於太真，以登空步虚，乘魁蹑纲，缠络七元，上升玉清之道，以备飞行羽经。

The mystic radiance soars aloft in the void,
A gentle breeze bears the sun on its wings.
The white simurgh swiftly follows the phoenix,
Its beak holding the divine *Feathered Writ*.
Beating their pinions, they shake the nine heavens,
Their mournful cries illumine the dark beams.
Arcane incantations issue forth through the air,
The pure governance of the Dao knows no end.
The assembled immortals join in celebration,
Bowing their heads in homage to the Jade Sovereign.

When the recitation concluded, the Celestial Emperor of the Great Thearch rose again, facing north, and intoned:

*"The dark phoenix darts on cloud-wings,
The white simurgh rejoices in its stride.
Flying fragrance blends with fragrant blossoms,
Meteors gleam along the clouded thoroughfares.
A mighty rainbow reins the long bridle,
Flying immortals support one another.
The ten thousand perfected celebrate this felicitous fortune,
Joyous phoenixes roam the empty midst.
The Primal Beginning leaves no trace,
Yet the mystic resonance seeks itself.
Beating their wings without awaiting a chariot,
They drift lightly upon the mists of affinity.
The treasure scripture weaves the dark warp,
The five bodies command the numinous talismans.
In celebration they bow before the Court of Blessings,
Circumambulating the incense thrice."*

When this recitation ended, the Heavenly Emperor rose, facing east, and intoned:

*"White feathers and dark wings flutter,
Riding the floating mists in cyclic return.
Flowing fragrance overflows the ten heavens,
Fragrant fungi flourish in the Supreme Tenuity.
The numinous scripture unlocks the hidden mechanism,
The *Feathered Writ* shines with mystic splendor.
The supreme Dao is fundamentally without obscurity,
Holding fast to the true, the radiant scene soars white."*

When this too concluded, the Venerable Lord of the Great Perfected donned his ritual vestments: a crown of the Infinite Three Treasures of Heaven, a robe of seamless nine-colored flying clouds adorned with luminous feathered script, a tinkling bell at his left, and the Seven Primes at his right. Facing due south, he prostrated himself. The Celestial Emperor of the Supreme Tenuity then commanded the Feathered Immortal Attendant to raise a golden table, bearing the scripture as he stood facing north, and presented it to the Great Perfected. All the immortals voiced their approval, and the Great Perfected rose to receive the scripture. A golden light emanated from his countenance, and the five agents of his body spontaneously generated the *Numinous Flying Jade Talismans*. Ascending with the assembled perfected, they boarded the white simurgh’s chariot, drawn by black-winged phoenixes, to feast in the verdant groves and azure waters of the Eastern Expanse of Eternal Yang, the precincts of Fusang, the mouth of the Nine Springs. They journeyed west to the dark-feathered plain of the White Wilderness by the banks of the Mengsi, south to the Crimson Mound and the essence of extreme flame in the southern lands of Xia, north to the frigid halls of the Northern Darkness and the abode of the Cold Waters, and circled the ten absolute peaks of the Yellow Qi and the Yang Essence in the Great Mysterious Jade Capital, the Golden Terrace, the Jade Chamber, and the Cinnabar Palace. They roamed the ten heavens and the eight domains of the Grotto Clarity, governing the countless perfected. No heaven was beyond their reach, no hidden realm beyond their purview, no *qi* beyond their command, no immortal beyond their charge. They universally governed the host of spirits, and from heaven downward, none failed to model their virtue upon the Great Perfected or revere the *Feathered Writ*.

Thereupon, the Celestial Lords each ascended their dark palanquins, and after seven thousand kalpas, transmitted the scripture to the Most High Lord of the Great Dao. The *Upper Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Dark Immortal Feathered Essence* is worn for seven years, enabling one to ride the void and ascend to the Seven Primes. Those who cultivate the *Feathered Writ’s* flying paces without this talisman cannot ascend the void to the dark mysteries. The recipient pledges to heaven with ninety feet of azure brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the left palm allows one to grasp the azure radiance and take flight. Inscribing nine inches of azure silk and wearing it on the left elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending at the left.

The *Lower Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Primal Feathered Essence of Dark Jade* is worn for seven years, enabling one to ride the void and ascend to the Five Stars. Those who practice the flying paces to ascend the dark mysteries without this talisman cannot traverse the void. The recipient pledges to heaven with sixty feet of white brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the right palm allows one to grasp the white radiance and take flight. Inscribing nine inches of white silk and wearing it on the right elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending at the right.

The *Left Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Dark Qi’s Primal Essence and White Feathered Writ* is worn for nine years, enabling one to ride the void and ascend to the Five Stars. Those who practice the flying paces to ascend the dark mysteries without this talisman cannot tread the clouds to ascend the dark mysteries. The recipient pledges to heaven with eighty feet of cinnabar brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the sole of the left foot allows one to tread the void and take flight. Inscribing nine inches of crimson silk and wearing it on the left elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending at the front.

The *Right Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Primal Qi’s Essence and Ascending Dark Feathered Writ* is worn for nine years, enabling one to ride the flying clouds and traverse the Jade Clarity. Those who cultivate the flying paces without this talisman cannot tread the Seven Primes to ascend the void. The recipient pledges to heaven with fifty feet of dark brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman upon the sole of the right foot allows one to tread the dark and take flight. Inscribing nine inches of black silk and wearing it on the right elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending at the rear.

The *Great Numinous Flying Jade Talisman of the Yang Qi’s Yellow Essence and Flying Feathered Writ* is worn for nine years, causing a golden light to emanate from the face, enabling one to vanish while sitting or standing and to fly through the great void. Those who cultivate the flying paces without this talisman cannot ascend to the stellar pivots or transcend the Nine Darks. The recipient pledges to heaven with twelve feet of yellow brocade. On the day of ascetic practice, inscribing the talisman before the heart allows one to exhale *qi* as clouds and ride them in flight. Inscribing nine inches of yellow silk and wearing it on the left elbow summons the Six Jia and Twelve Spirits, with twelve *Numinous Flying Jade Maidens* attending the body.

In all practices of meditative visualization upon the Seven Stars, one must first ingest the five talismans before inscribing them. When inscribing or ingesting the talismans, face east, click the teeth twelve times, and pray aloud:

*"Dark Void and Purple Clarity,
Flying *Feathered Writ*,
Above you illumine the cloud palaces,
Below you command the thousand spirits.
You govern the Six Jia,
Transport my bodily form,
Traverse the celestial warp,
Ascend to grasp the Dipper’s essence.
Congeal the hun and solidify the po,
Internally secure and fill the self.
Exiting the void and entering the dark,
Ever abide with the qi."*

Upon completion, ingest the talisman and inscribe it upon the five centers, then proceed with the practice. After nine years of such cultivation, one may ride the void and command the clouds, flying through the Great Clarity. The *Left* and *Right Numinous Flying Jade Talismans* emerge from the *qi* of spontaneity, transmitted by the Great Perfected to ascend the void, tread the celestial warp, entwine the Seven Primes, and ascend to the Jade Clarity, perfecting the *Flying Feathered Writ*.

chunks.original_text: 得之者神仙，佩之者成真人，修之者致白鸾之车，黑翮之凤，来迎子身，上登玉清宫，游宴常阳。 太上大道君以传上元太素君、太微天帝君，施行道成，秘於太上灵都之宫。 依科三千年一传，不得轻泄宣露天真，违盟负誓，身没鬼官，殃及九祖，充闭幽泉。 飞行羽经九真升元上记 太上大道君，昔受飞行羽经九真升玄上记，宝言紫文绿金之字，超虚蹑空浮景之道，於玉清上宫虚皇高上道君。 於是太上大道君以其要传上清玉帝君，上清玉帝君以传上元太素君，上元太素君又传太微天帝君。 太微天帝君施行真秘，以传晨中黄景君，晨中黄景君又以传皇初紫灵君，皇初紫灵君以传中央黄老君，中央黄老君以传九微太真玉保王金阙上相大司命高晨师青童大君梵湄，使以此文教授当得为真人者也。 诸有太素绛录及金阙刻名，皆当得见此文。 自非其人，不得与相遇。 欲出传之者，必须精应感畅，乃付之耳。 歃盟断金，誓以不宣之信矣。 有此经者，太素三元君遣玉童二十四人，玉女二十四人，侍经之左右，纠刺泄慢之愆，卫护有经者身。 此中真之道也，非仙次第之中也。 盖中和之中真也，配简三元，名刊太素，行则紫毛之节，驾则八景云舆，前导万灵，后从千真，九凤齐呜，天钧唱弦，神龙启导，五帝縿轩，飞行太空，遨宴丹霄，位为上清真人玉卿之师。 诸有太上飞行羽经升玄九真者，听三千年六传，遇其人一日顿授之。 若无可授者，三千年限尽，以朱书素写六通，封之峨媚山金台之室。 过此不复传出。 不可授而传者，泄真人之道也。 受而不承科者，毁真人之誓也。 授者经师，受者宗焉。 违经慢范，宣露宝文者，七祖父母诣玄都，受风刀之考，身为下鬼，积幽夜之河也。 欲受飞行，散金为盟，欲知仙忌，文巾为质，既知羽书，天地同符，子闻玄文，超驾庆云，此之谓也。 出委羽洞台刻石铭。 太素三元君有言日：仙人始知瘾庇斗星之道，而未知真人藏斗星之法。 夫九斗者，天枢之正盖，玄轴之华宝，机纽八维，总旋九度，回荫圆方，运摄和气，理调阴阳，司适无外。 夫斗星者，朗曜为之夜翳，璇玑为之动用，四象为之流坠，玄明焕烂，威光赫蔚矣。 太无帝君有言曰：仙人徒知咀嚼阴阳，吐纳二气，而不知斗星者，是阴阳之根府，二象之玄纲也。 乃苦辛玩其波末，而不识营始而甚易，荫庇其枝条，而失乎根本矣。 何不藏九斗，陶冶至象耶。 行之十四年，太上迎以琼轮，超虚蹑空，上登上清，列为上真，反神婴颜，众神侍轩。 青童大君有言曰：仙人徒知璇玑大威，焕惧万辰，睹九道之流赫，玩圆动以摄神，庇之以求大度，用之以求神仙，而犹不识回九光以内照，藏明斗於泥丸，於是魂凝魄炼，合德云姻，解其道上升上清，得其道身为上真。 是以真人抱大象以匿霞，包斗精以藏身，我先师是故左驾绿云，右辔绛晨，身升太素，超虚蹑空，存斗星紫色，其纲赤色，觉紫色之气温温暖也。 存星大小，在意行之。 此青童君口诀。 昔梧成子、谷希子、广成子、青真子，合存斗星之气，并与身共入莲实之中，忽见莲内有千里金池，玉山万顷，宫台宇室，盖亦连云，朱木结实，紫华生园，碧辇玄黄，三素八轮，奇异之观，不可名字。

Those who attain it become divine immortals; those who wear it become perfected beings. Those who cultivate it summon the white-luan chariot and the black-winged phoenix to welcome their bodies, ascending to the Jade Clarity Palace to roam and feast in the Eternal Yang. The Most High Lord of the Great Dao transmitted it to the Supreme Prime Lord of Grand Simplicity and the Celestial Emperor of the Grand Tenuity. When the Dao is practiced to completion, it is concealed within the Numinous Capital of the Most High. According to the regulations, it is transmitted once every three thousand years, and must not be lightly divulged or revealed to celestial perfected ones. Those who violate the covenant and betray their oaths will have their bodies consigned to the offices of ghosts, their misfortune extending to nine generations, bound in the Dark Springs.

*The Flying Feathered Writ: Nine Perfected Ascending to the Primordial Upper Record*
The Most High Lord of the Great Dao once received *The Flying Feathered Writ: Nine Perfected Ascending to the Primordial Upper Record*, its treasured words inscribed in purple script and green-gold characters, the Dao of traversing the void and treading the empty sky upon floating radiance, bestowed by the Highest Lord of the Dao in the Jade Clarity Upper Palace. Thereupon, the Most High Lord of the Great Dao transmitted its essentials to the Jade Emperor of the Highest Clarity. The Jade Emperor of the Highest Clarity transmitted it to the Supreme Prime Lord of Grand Simplicity, who in turn transmitted it to the Celestial Emperor of the Grand Tenuity. The Celestial Emperor of the Grand Tenuity practiced its true secrets and transmitted it to the Yellow Radiance Lord of the Central Dawn. The Yellow Radiance Lord of the Central Dawn transmitted it to the Purple Numinosity Lord of the Primordial Beginning, who transmitted it to the Yellow Elder Lord of the Center. The Yellow Elder Lord of the Center transmitted it to the Jade Guardian King of the Nine Subtleties, the Great Minister of Fate, the High Dawn Master, the Azure Lad, and the Great Lord Fanmei, instructing them to teach this text to those worthy of becoming perfected beings. All who possess the *Crimson Record of Grand Simplicity* or whose names are inscribed in the Golden Portal shall be permitted to behold this text. Those unworthy shall not encounter it. Should one wish to transmit it, one must first attain perfect resonance and response before bestowing it. They shall swear an unbreakable oath, pledging inviolable secrecy.

Those who possess this scripture shall be attended by twenty-four Jade Lads and twenty-four Jade Maidens sent by the Three Primordial Lords of Grand Simplicity, who shall stand to the left and right of the scripture, correcting and restraining transgressions of carelessness and disclosure, guarding and protecting the bearer. This is the Dao of the central perfected, not of the ordinary ranks of immortals. It is the central perfection of harmony, aligned with the registers of the Three Primes, its name recorded in Grand Simplicity. In action, it is marked by purple-feathered standards; in travel, it is borne by the eight-radiance cloud chariot. Ten thousand spirits lead the way, a thousand perfected follow behind. Nine phoenixes cry in unison, celestial zithers play their strings. Divine dragons open the path, the Five Emperors’ banners flutter. They traverse the Great Void, roaming and feasting in the Cinnabar Empyrean, attaining the rank of Master of the Jade Ministers among the Perfected of the Highest Clarity.

All who possess *The Flying Feathered Writ of the Most High: Ascending to the Primordial Nine Perfected* shall observe the rule of six transmissions in three thousand years. If a worthy recipient is found, it may be bestowed in a single day. If none are found when the three-thousand-year limit expires, six copies shall be inscribed in red on plain silk, sealed within the Golden Terrace Chamber of Mount Emei. Beyond this, it shall not be transmitted again. To transmit it to the unworthy is to divulge the Dao of the perfected. To receive it without upholding the regulations is to violate the oath of the perfected. The transmitter is the scripture master; the recipient is their disciple. Those who defy the scripture, disregard its precepts, or reveal its treasured words shall have their seven generations of ancestors brought before the Dark Capital to endure the trials of the Wind Blade. Their bodies shall become lowly ghosts, submerged in the River of Eternal Night.

To receive the *Flying Feathered Writ*, scatter gold as an oath. To know the taboos of immortality, offer a silk kerchief as a pledge. Once you comprehend the feathered scripture, heaven and earth become as one. Having heard these mysterious words, you shall transcend and ride the auspicious clouds—this is what it means.

*Inscribed on the stone stele of the Terrace of Committed Feathers.*

The Three Primordial Lords of Grand Simplicity have said: Immortals first know the Dao of concealing themselves beneath the Dipper’s stars, yet do not know the method by which perfected beings conceal the Dipper’s stars. The Nine Dipper stars are the true canopy of the Celestial Pivot, the radiant treasure of the Mysterious Axis, the mechanism that binds the eight directions, the hub that revolves the nine measures. They turn and shade the square and round, governing and harmonizing the qi, regulating yin and yang, presiding over all without exception.

The Dipper’s stars—brilliant and luminous—veil the night. The turning jade mechanism sets them in motion. The Four Symbols flow and descend from them. Mysterious brightness shines resplendently, their majestic radiance blazing. The Supreme Lord of the Great Void has said: Immortals merely know how to chew yin and yang, to exhale and inhale the two qi, yet do not know that the Dipper’s stars are the root and repository of yin and yang, the mysterious warp of the two images. They toil arduously at the waves’ ends, failing to recognize the ease of tending to the source. They shelter beneath its branches and leaves, yet lose the root and foundation. Why not conceal the Nine Dipper, refining and forging the supreme image?

Practice this for fourteen years, and the Most High shall welcome you with a jade wheel. You shall traverse the void and tread the empty sky, ascending to the Highest Clarity, ranked among the supreme perfected. Your spirit shall return, your countenance rejuvenated, and all spirits shall attend your chariot. The Azure Lad has said: Immortals merely know the great majesty of the turning jade mechanism, its brilliance startling the myriad stars. They behold the flowing radiance of the nine paths, delight in its circular motion to gather the spirit, sheltering beneath it to seek great attainment, employing it to seek divine immortality. Yet they still do not know how to turn the nine lights inward to illuminate, to conceal the bright Dipper within the muddy pellet. Thereby, the hun is congealed and the po refined, virtue and cloud-mist harmonized. Those who master this Dao ascend to the Highest Clarity; those who attain it become supreme perfected.

chunks.original_text: 夫真人作法，所贵於安其所安，崇妙简微，不复曲折败常，乖乎寝处也。 要道不烦，乃绝伦矣。 后施三祝之法，皆依希拟象此行也。 但祝不同，及存星有背向之异耳。 要言在於密房曲室，勿令有见其存思时也。 所以尔者，存思时玉童玉女将在侧而监焉，不可吊丧临尸，经秽殗，衣被巾履一切勿错越，以假借於非类矣。 何谓非类耶，不同志契者是也。 非我同好，不与同席而坐，非我同盟，弗与同器而食。 道俗有殊，有崇奉六天及事山川魔神者，弗居其室，弗飨其饥，勿着其衣，勿冠其巾，盖避其尸秽之下气，遏其邪风之往来也。 此所谓真道之真道矣，精妙之精妙也。 若能为其妙，乃得其真道，避其秽乃获其新。 若将混沌杂栖，臭香齐器，不标其神，不整其气，滛真同居，贪廉共位，厕邪风而不荡心，履尘壤而不思超迈者，以此寻真为无也。 夜光不生於粪阱，下才不植於标领，此之谓也。 精感仿髴，灵应机微，玉华告验，神光表晖，自非尔师，勿妄与之言也。 斗中大神者，盖九星之精，因感变而忽生矣。 是施行时，当心存名字，至后祝曰止。 后祝自后有神，又存如初。 若是泥丸中星神，恒存居其中。 每事效此为象。 存斗星来下，令极思不觉，忽然已在我形中也。 初存或未来时仿髴，但极思念之，如已在形中，亦足致感也。 久久自渐入妙。 月七日、九日、十三日，禺中时，若夜半时，入室正坐，接手定气临目毕，乃存北斗九星来下入心中，以柄杓坚仰向喉，魁中向外也。 良久，忽然见魁中有一大神，衣服名字如祝所言。 极久，当觉心中温温暖，真气来入也。 乃咽液五十过，叩齿九通，举右手第二指以捻心，於是乃微咒曰： 太上紫真，九气中灵，包括万度，璇玑焕明，飞霞流曜，晖烛玉清，玄盖众晨，阴阳判成，四和交降，七纬顺生，肇月吉辰，来映心庭，飞光络景，中元充盈，六府启关，华液泯平，魂魄制炼，得真之精，感至触变，亿兆立成，忽见大神，坐安心房，整气潮津，百节流通，攀斗据魁，盻邈百方，其名璇度，厥字素康，绛羽华帔，龙带虎裳，身生宝曜，项负圆光，首巾飞晨，英冠低昂，使我飞仙，超浮太空，上造紫阙，北朝玉皇，役使万神，众灵奉迎，心上生华，庆云永昌，凤啸玲玲，鸾吹锵锵。 祝毕，咽液三十过，叩齿九通，又祝如前，祝毕，起南向再拜，事毕，乃开目○ 月十五日、十九日、二十三日，禺中时，若夜半时，入室正坐，接手定气临目毕，乃存北斗九星来下，入脐下三寸下元宫中，以斗柄杓坚向心，魁中向外。 极久，忽见魁中有一大神，衣服名字如祝所言，亦当觉脐中温温热，真气来至也。 乃咽液六十过，叩齿九通，举左手第三指以捻鼻下人中，於是乃微祝曰： 太上紫皇，焕朗中枢，九纬炳蔼，光秀太霞，万灵仰镇，千晨植牙，七度用明，九烟芬葩，制阳表顺，执阴以和，真晖启阵，玄根总罗，肇月惟吉，观映脐内，紫气发霄，飞光纵坠，炼我魂魄，华津荣蔚，忽见大神，上宫灵贵，名曰祝萌，厥字流郁，正坐脐中，乘斗九气，吐纳灵液，平血理胃，黄凤羽帔，龙衣虎带，手启日根，头戴绿芙，腰生流火，焕电映无，使我飞仙，超虚蹑浮，上造玉房，担带霄虚，役使万神，天地同休。

Bearing the canopy of the celestial void,
Commanding the myriad spirits,
Heaven and Earth in shared repose."*

This Dao is the secret wonder of transcending emptiness, the marvelous method of the Nine Perfected. The practice is divided into three stages, with nine days of monthly cultivation—hence it is called the *Nine Perfected Ascending the Mysterious Writ*. It is a treasured text among the esoteric scriptures of the Supreme Perfected, the essential formula for attaining perfection.

When transmitting this to a worthy recipient, the receiver must first undergo a purification fast for one hundred days, or thirty days, or ten days, according to their capacity. Additionally, they should observe a one-day fast beforehand to cleanse their sincere heart. The transmitter must also fast in the same manner as the receiver. On the day of transmission, both parties shall first draw blood to consecrate the altar, cut their hair, and swear an oath of secrecy. Later sages, however, deemed blood sacrifice harmful to the vitality of living beings and hair-cutting a violation of bodily integrity. Thus, they substituted three taels of yellow gold for the blood oath and thirty-two feet of green silk for the hair-cutting pledge.

The master and disciple must not treat these oath objects as private possessions or misuse them; instead, they should be offered to reclusive Daoists dwelling in lofty mountains or to solitary, impoverished practitioners. If one has ascended to walk the void, the objects may be cast into mountain chambers or scattered upon sacred peaks. This is done to demonstrate that heavenly trust is profound and the Dao’s essence is prized above material wealth.

Those who violate these precepts will cause their seven generations of ancestors to suffer the trials of the Wind Blade in the Dark Capital, while their own souls shall become lowly ghosts. The transmission period, the method of bestowal, and all procedures must adhere strictly to the above regulations, with oath objects of the finest quality. The recipient’s heart must be pure and refined, their sincerity unwavering, and their devotion complete.

The transmitter is the master and guide, while the receiver is the disciple. Those who hear the Dao should look to the master as their model; those who seek life should dwell near the realm of life. Those who fail to uphold these teachings, who neglect or disrespect them, will cause their three generations of ancestors to be punished by the Fire Bureau, while they themselves shall be afflicted with lifelong ailments.

The Yellow Emperor once studied under the Master of Mount Jing, who knew only the method of refining stones—no other wonders—and was hardly superior to the Yellow Emperor. Yet because the Yellow Emperor inquired about the art of refining stones, he became his disciple. The Master of Mount Jing was a descendant of Lord You of Ji and now resides on Mount Weiyu. He can refine stones into water, boil water into jade, and grind jade into powder, which he consumes with stone water. Those who master this art may endure as long as heaven itself, yet they cannot soar through the empty void or grasp the morning mist in their hands. Though the art of refining stones is marvelous, it remains but a minor technique.

Here ends the *Supreme Perfected’s Scripture of Soaring on Wings: The Upper Record of the Nine Perfected Ascending the Mysterious*. The following section is the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected of the Supreme Perfected*. Though it contains an upper and lower sequence, its methods and applications differ and do not intersect.

The Central Yellow Lord of the Dao transmitted this to the Perfected of the Great Void, alongside the *Eight Esoteric Sayings*. The *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected* is practiced among humans and includes oral instructions, though the main text is too sacred to be written. Now, the prescribed methods are as follows:

**First Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 5th, 15th, 25th, 27th, and 29th days of the fifth month—five times in a month, all at dawn.

**Second Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 8th, 11th, 14th, 19th, 23rd, and 27th days of the eighth month—six times in a month, all at the hour of *chen* (7–9 AM).

**Third Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 6th, 7th, 17th, 18th, 25th, and 26th days of the sixth month—six times in a month, all at the hour of *si* (9–11 AM).

**Fourth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 2nd, 8th, 14th, 18th, 19th, and 28th days of the first month—six times in a month, all at noon.

**Fifth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 3rd, 8th, 13th, 20th, and 26th days of the third month—five times in a month, all at the hour of *wei* (1–3 PM).

**Sixth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 7th, 11th, 14th, 18th, 23rd, 25th, and 28th days of the seventh month—seven times in a month, all at the hour of *shen* (3–5 PM).

**Seventh Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 2nd, 6th, 9th, 13th, 16th, 19th, 23rd, and 27th days of the eleventh month—eight times in a month, all at the hour of *you* (5–7 PM).

**Eighth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 2nd, 7th, 9th, 15th, 18th, 19th, and 27th days of the second month—seven times in a month, all at the hour of *xu* or *hai* (7–11 PM).

**Ninth Perfected Method**: To be practiced on the 3rd, 9th, 17th, 19th, 26th, and 29th days of the twelfth month—six times in a month, all at midnight.

Here end the oral instructions of the *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected*. These days and hours are when the qi of life converges and the essence of the Perfected aligns, making it most auspicious for visualization and readily invoking the mysterious response. If one dwells in seclusion atop lofty peaks, hidden among cloud-wreathed cliffs, severs all worldly ties, purifies the intestines by abstaining from grains, joins hands to rectify the heart, and meditates upon the morning’s essence, they should practice daily as prescribed in the original scripture.

However, as most people in the world are occupied with affairs and cannot cultivate in daily tranquility, the above schedule is provided. Practicing for fourteen years is sufficient to transcend the empty void, master life and death, pass through water and fire, ascend to the Supreme Clarity, cause the five viscera to blossom, and commune with heaven.

The *Upper Scroll of the Scripture of Ascending the Mysterious on Wings* requires three repetitions in a month, totaling nine days—this is due to the world’s lack of perfect stillness. If one maintains long fasts, embraces solitude, gazes upon the empty vastness, and focuses the heart beyond worldly matters, they should practice on these days in sequence.
